fields.alt: An estate with trees and a small path
fields.title: Rural Estate

fields.alt: A small house at the end of a broad path with trees on either side
fields.title: City Estate 1

fields.alt: A large building at the end of a broad path, surrounded by trees
fields.title: City Estate 2

fields.alt: A stream of water with grass on the far side
fields.title: Stream

fields.alt: A wooden club with metal spikes
fields.title: Spiked Club

fields.alt: A slightly curved longbow and a fletched arrow
fields.title: Bow and Arrow

fields.alt: An open book stacked on other books
fields.title: Book

fields.alt: A stack of three large hardcover books
fields.title: Stacked Books

fields.alt: A plate with food, a wine glass and bottle, pieces of silverware
fields.title: Meal

fields.alt: An old window in a stone wall
fields.title: Window

fields.alt: A tall door with inset panels
fields.title: Door

fields.description: Walking down the thoroughfare, you encounter a group of rough-looking locals shoving a young lad. You hear shouts of "Thief!" and "Show us where you hid it!"
fields.title: A Commotion in the Street

fields.description: A group of deer runs past, keeping a cautious distance but well within sight. Will you pursue them?
fields.title: Swift Stags

fields.description: A battered wooden chest with strong iron clamps rests insolently on the ground. Does it dare keep its treasure from you?
fields.title: A Locked Chest!

fields.description: The skies are clear this evening, and you pause to look at the shimmering lights above. A single bright flash appears long enough for you to trace its path. According to superstition, wishes made in the wake of a star's passing are more likely to come true. For what will you wish?
fields.title: Shooting Star

fields.description: You meet a man who claims to be a master of the ether. For a few coins he will travel with you for the day and share its mysteries with you.
fields.title: Wandering Teacher

fields.description: Some creature has been snacking on your rations! At least, you presume that's the the reason for the hole chewed in your pack, the removal of rations and the addition of crumbs.
fields.title: Vermin!

fields.description: You step into the inviting warmth of a nearby tavern. Ale is flowing, tongues are loosened, and everyone seems to have a tale to tell. To whom will you listen?
fields.title: Tavern Tales

fields.description: A brother and sister call to you for help. They went to market two days earlier, but have not been able to find their way back home. They aren't sure exactly where their home is. Will you help them?
fields.title: Lost Children

fields.description: While hopping from stone to stone over a particularly wide steam, you notice a flash of light from beneath the water. It looks like someone lost their purse while making a similar leap, and now their coins lie under three feet of swiftly rushing water.
fields.title: Coins in the River

fields.description: A local promontory looms over the landscape. Several rough trails seem to offer passage up its slope.
fields.title: To the Mountaintop

fields.description: An irate farmer is trying to get rid of the starlings that have been devouring his berry crop, and will pay you to assist him.
fields.title: Clear the Field

fields.description: Books are precious and rare in Skal, so it's unusual to see them sold this openly. A gaunt man wearing once-respectable clothing offers to part with some of his treasures for a few coins.
fields.title: The Way of the Book

fields.description:
A fellow-traveler has reached the respectable age of thirty, and decided to hang up his adventuring sword for good. He's one of the lucky few who chose the right side in their fights, saved their coins, and got out before they were cut down. He and his wife just had their first son, and he intends to collect some memorable artifacts for his child's future.

"I remember well how I stumbled into the adventuring life. I had agreed to help my uncle move some carpets to the fair at a nearby town. Halfway there, we were attacked by highwaymen who had set up a barricade at the crossroads. There were three of them and only one of me, but I don't think they expected a fight! I grabbed the club from their leader's hand, and delivered a beating to the three of them before smashing down that barricade. I remember that there was a sign nearby, with the symbol of a fox standing upright. If you can find that sign, please bring it to me, and I'll pay its weight in copper coin."
fields.title: Calling All Adventurers

fields.description: You notice a sign hanging outside of a butcher shop: "Need a fresh supply of animals."
fields.title: Meet the Meat

fields.description: The butcher has asked you and Tomas to round up some grazing cattle outside of town.
fields.title: Corral Some Cattle

fields.description: The town's mutton supplies are dropping perilously low, and several large flocks have recently wandered off. Can you find some mature sheep for the butcher?
fields.title: Wooly Wanderers

fields.description: The town used to keep many pigs in fenced pens, but over the years many have escaped and now feral swine roam the forests nearby.
fields.title: Pernicious Pigs

fields.description: Many of the elite in town have recently developed a taste for rabbit: rabbit stew, rabbit roasts, grilled rabbit in an apricot glaze. The unexpected demand has caught the butcher unprepared, and he asks you to help refresh his stocks.
fields.title: Rare Rabbits

fields.description: The butcher has heard strange tales lately. A creature the locals have taken to calling the boagar has been sighted around town. Always appearing at dusk or at dawn, it supposedly has the body of a cougar but the tusks of a boar.
fields.title: A Mythical Beast?

fields.description: You've gathered a great deal of circumstantial evidence regarding the so-called "boagar", a beast with the body of a cougar and the tusks of a boar. The butcher has offered you a significant prize if you can capture or kill the animal and bring it in for the town to see.
fields.title: Capture the Beast!

fields.description: Like many villages, this town defers to the wisdom of local leaders. The Patriarch still has overall authority, but for matters beneath his attention, the village elder is expected to rule. The last elder died several months ago, and two men are bitterly contesting the succession. If you back the winner, you would gain a useful ally.
fields.title: The New Elder

fields.description: If you are going to represent them to the populace, you'll need to get to know the elder better. What strengths can they offer? What topics should they avoid?
fields.title: A Chat with the Elder-in-Waiting

fields.description: Ultimately, the Patriarch will appoint the new elder. In these modern times, though, Patriarchs are wary of the country peasants and city laborers. You don't necessarily need their support, but you'll want to make sure they don't cause trouble.
fields.title: Consulting the Commoners

fields.description: The men who sell food, clothing, and lodging to the town's residents have a great deal of influence in the selection of a new elder. Try to convince them to use that influence in your favor.
fields.title: Mingling with the Merchants

fields.description: Descor, a powerful nephew of the Patriarch, has been seen traveling through town. No doubt he has important business to attend, but a word in his ear could have an enormous impact on the elder's selection.
fields.title: Influencing Descor

fields.description: Neither Blacksmith Peter nor Drygoodsman Sam are technically the eldest man in the village. That honor belongs to Old Andrew, who has loudly denied any desire for the chair, but whose opinion will still carry a great deal of weight in the decision.
fields.title: Old Andrew

fields.description: The Patriarch's agent is ready to choose the new elder. He has asked to speak with you in private before the appointment is official.
fields.title: An Audience with Descor

fields.description: Your two feet have served you well thus far, but four feet would allow you to cover ground much more quickly and ease travel to nearby Houses.
fields.title: Your Steed

fields.description: Temor, a distant nephew to Patriarch Naper, has been spotted in town. Nobody seems to know his business, but he does appear to spend an inordinate amount of time in the tavern.
fields.title: Catching Spies

fields.description: Sam the drygoodsman sold Temor supplies when he last passed through town. He may have had opportunity to look in Temor's satchel while loading his horse.
fields.title: Investigate the Drygoodsman

fields.description: Temor employed a guide when he passed this way before. She usually hunts animals in the forest. Can you remain hidden and observe her movements?
fields.title: Chase the Huntress

fields.description: Temor had sent several less-important messages back to the Patriarch with a local boy. He believes that the boy never saw the secret documents, but wants you to make sure.
fields.title: Trail the Messenger

fields.description: The limping adventurer arrived in town around the same time as Temor. Nobody knows his name, nor how he can earn a living in his reduced state.
fields.title: Follow a Limping Adventurer

fields.description: Her name wasn't on Temor's list, but you've heard rumors of his dalliance with the tavernkeeper's daughter. If you're going to be thorough in your job, you'll need to investigate her connections as well.
fields.title: Shadow the Mistress

fields.description: You have been following Temor's suspects for long enough. It's time to make your report.
fields.title: Accusation

fields.description: You encounter an irate gamekeeper in the woods. He is angrily ripping up some traps that have been cunningly laid under a nearby pile of leaves.
fields.title: Disputed Lands

fields.description: You hear the sound of a rabbit caught in a snare. It must be the poachers!
fields.title: Disarm a Snare

fields.description: One of the poachers has rigged up a large rock to fall and crush any animal that nudges aside the stick propping it up. You need to remove this threat, but how to do so without getting crushed yourself?
fields.title: Evade a Boulder

fields.description: A premonition pricks the back of your neck. The forest floor in front looks a little too neatly groomed. A pit trap may be hidden somewhere ahead.
fields.title: Watch Your Step

fields.description: It's time to turn the table on the poachers. The gamekeeper has given you permission to set traps of your own in hopes of capturing the perpetrators.
fields.title: Dangerous Game

fields.description: The gamekeeper and you have been laying traps for the poachers in the Patriarch's forest. Judging from the shouts, one of them has just been caught!
fields.title: Spring a Poacher

fields.description: At long last, you and the gamekeeper have located the poachers' camp. They outnumber you, though, and look like they're prepared for a fight.
fields.title: Chief Poacher

fields.description: The road near town tends to grow congested on market day, with carts backing up and tempers rising. The slowdown comes from an ancient stone bridge that crosses a nearby river. It likely served the town well centuries ago, but with recent growth it no longer can handle the increase in traffic.
fields.title: Building a Bridge

fields.description: Forests fill much of the countryside. You hear the sounds of sawing and crashing trees in the distance.
fields.title: Timber Claim

fields.description: If you have collected enough timber, you can sell it to the crew that's working on the bridge.
fields.title: Timber Sale

fields.description: By the time metal reaches the market, its price is well set. If you can meet with a miner before then, though, the cost is much more malleable.
fields.title: Prospecting Ore

fields.description: The bridge construction crew is starting to craft the fasteners that will hold the beams in place. As such, they are eager to acquire more iron.
fields.title: More Ore

fields.description: The bridge is nearing completion, but many of the workers have already taken their wages and departed on an epic drinking binge. The frantic foreman offers to pay you to recruit fresh builders.
fields.title: Hire More Laborers

fields.description: After much hard work, the new bridge is almost ready for use. Rumors say that Patriarch Engoth himself may come to witness the celebration.
fields.title: Opening Ceremony

fields.description: You've been having unusual dreams lately. When you wake up, you are sprawled in unusual positions, and objects around your cot seem to have been jarred out of place. What's going on?
fields.title: Tremoring

fields.description: If you want to master ether, you'll need to determine how you're affecting it.
fields.title: Introspection

fields.description: You've noticed odd things happening while you sleep. Perhaps you can quantify what is and isn't possible with this... force.
fields.title: Conduct Experiments in Ether

fields.description: You have made some observations of ether effectiveness when asleep. Can you discern anything similar while awake?
fields.title: Continue Experimenting in Ether

fields.description: You've had some practice with manipulating objects through the ether. Can you try and pinpoint exactly what the ether is?
fields.title: Ether Theory

fields.description: You've heard rumors of places in the Kingdom where etherists gather openly and share their arts with one another. Perhaps you will visit there sometime. Meanwhile, you can correspond with them and perhaps gain in understanding.
fields.title: Write a Letter to Etherists

fields.description: You have been having strange dreams lately. Sometimes, but not always, objects shift around while you're asleep.
fields.title: Dreams of Movement

fields.description: You've been able to shift around several objects without touching them, but only while asleep. You decide to see how large and heavy an item you can move.
fields.title: Mind over Matter

fields.description: You've had some success thus far with shifting around items, but mostly while dreaming. See if you can repeat the feat while awake.
fields.title: Waking Movement

fields.description: You've had fun experimenting with ether, and can even imagine making a modest living from parlor tricks and placing bets. It seems like a waste of your talents, though. Surely you can find a more practical application for your talent.
fields.title: Ethereal Agriculture

fields.description: You've shown that you can move around a variety of objects. If you want to make this a useful skill, though, you'll need to develop a finer degree of control over that movement.
fields.title: Threading the Needle

fields.description: You hear a loud crash and leap back as two bodies fly out of the tavern door. They seem intent on pummeling one another, while a third party behind them continues landing blows of his own. The din is deafening.
fields.title: A Din in the Street

fields.description: You spot a large, lumbering, dim-looking brute lurching towards you. This must be Martin, the youngest and worst-smelling of the Baird brothers.
fields.title: Wrestling Martin Baird

fields.description: The middle brother is an enormous but surprisingly agile man. Punching him would require getting too close; you'll need a tool to extend your reach.
fields.title: Bringing Down Glen Baird

fields.description: Carl is the oldest of the Baird brothers, and therefore has been brawling for longer than any of them. He has expressed displeasure at your tussles with the brothers, and put out word that he wants a straight fight with you.
fields.title: Confront Carl Baird

fields.description: A woman dressed in muted green sits silently next to a tree. She holds a longbow loosely in her hand, intently watching the forest interior.
fields.title: Bending Bows

fields.description: A huntress has suggested that you practice your archery on some large, immobile objects. Those large piles of hay should do nicely.
fields.title: Hitting Haystacks

fields.description: You feel that you have exceeded the challenge presented by large, formless blobs of straw. It's time to turn your attention to smaller, man-shaped bundles of straw.
fields.title: Straw Men

fields.description: The huntress takes you along on her next expedition. You crest a hill, and see several large wild boars clustered around a stream, nudging one another as they drink. She nods at you: Your shot.
fields.title: Shooting a Boar

fields.description: A loud clamor arises behind you. Turning, you see several uniformed soldiers chasing a small band of vicious, desperate-looking highwaymen.
fields.title: Crossing Swords with Brigands

fields.description: Once again, you hear the noise of conflict before spotting it. A squadron of soldiers in chainmail armor and wielding broadswords have surrounded a smaller knot of brigands in rough leather vests armed with clubs and daggers.
fields.title: Observe a Battle with Brigands

fields.description: A squad of soldiers hail you. "We have pinned down a gang of brigands and will launch our final assault soon. Care to join in the melee?"
fields.title: Fighting Brigands

fields.description: A gang of four brigands are robbing a merchant. The crime is bold, on a major road often patrolled by House soldiers, but nobody else is in sight at the moment. Will you assist the victim?
fields.title: To the Rescue

fields.description: An unruly band of soldiers have defected from House Gol's army and have begun pillaging this area. A group of farmers plead with you to scare them off.
fields.title: Deserters

fields.description: One of House Naper's agents is in town, recruiting adventurers to help combat Naper's brigands.
fields.title: The Road to Naper

fields.description: The moans of the wounded float around you. Your caretakers must be busy with the new arrivals.
fields.title: An Idle Day

fields.description: You feel healthy and happy once again. You are ready to head back into the world.
fields.title: Recovered

fields.description: Welcome to Skal! You have arrived as all do, a little child. Tell us some more about the background of your story: who were your parents?
fields.title: Your Origins

fields.description: Skal is a game, and also the name of the world within the game. You will create a character and guide their decisions throughout the story. Each decision will shape the kind of person you become: kind or cruel, strong or subtle, wise or brash. At any given time, you will see one or more scenarios like this presented to you, and can choose any one that interests you. Click the button below to view your choices.
fields.title: Welcome to Skal!

fields.description: As you grew older, you became more independent, developing particular interests of your own. How did you spend most of your time?
fields.title: Childhood Adventures

fields.description:
As you grow older, your sense of independence rises, and you increasingly wish to find your own way in the world. The world outside your village remains mysterious, and you will need assistance to discover its secrets. A hooded traveler from House Hansa offers to sell you a map of the surrounding countryside for the low price of 3 royals.

In order to buy the map, complete chores under the Earn Money scenario. After you have acquired at least 3 royals, return to this scenario to continue your story.
fields.title: Buy a Map

fields.description:
In order to make your own way in life, you'll need to put aside a bit of coin for yourself. The currency in Skal is called the royal; most small trade is done with coins worth one royal each, but some larger denominations exist as well. How would you like to earn your money?

Note that this is the first Scenario where your choices are limited: you can only take an action for which you already have some skill. Choices may also be restricted until you acquire a certain number of royals, you possess a certain item, or you have made certain decisions in other scenarios. If you ever encounter a Scenario with no choices available, don't worry; just continue trying other choices, or travel to someplace new.

You can repeat this Scenario multiple times. After you have earned 3 royals, continue the Buy a Map scenario to advance your story.
fields.title: Earn Money

fields.description: You are now the proud owner of a barely-used map of the nearby countryside. It's nearly time to visit there.
fields.title: Preparing to Leave Town

fields.description:
You have outgrown what your childhood home can offer you. It's time for new adventures.

To continue in the story, click Travel on the menu above and select The Nearby Countryside. There you will find the next stage of your journey.
fields.title: Move Along

fields.description:
You are off in the world now, at the start of a long and hopefully prosperous journey. You're ready to start making your mark on the world. What will be your first quest?

This will be the last stage of your character's introduction. You can pursue any of the below quests that are available to you; depending on your choices so far, there may only be one. For the first time, you may see some choices that have a chance of failure. This indicates that your stats are not quite high enough to easily pass them. Don't worry, though: if you don't finish the quest on your first try, you can just keep trying until you win. As a bonus, each failure will slightly increase your stat, making future attempts more likely to succeed.
fields.title: Have An Adventure!

fields.description:
Congratulations once again! You have proven adept at navigating the ways of Skal, and are now ready to head out on your own. Your journey starts in the small trading village of Folls in House Engoth's lands. Where it goes from here, only you can decide.

Incidentally, you received a piece of equipment when you completed your last quest. Equipment is a special kind of item that provides a boost to one or more stats. You can only wear one of each type of equipment at a time - for example, one cloak, one sword, one pair of boots, and so on. Over time, you can buy better equipment and earn new equipment by completing quests. To put on your new equipment, click Profile in the menu above, and then click the name of the item.
fields.title: A Fresh Start

fields.description:
Congratulations once again! You have proven adept at navigating the ways of Skal, and are now ready to head out on your own. Your journey starts in the town of Tummon in House Naper's lands. Where it goes from here, only you can decide.

Incidentally, you received a piece of equipment when you completed your last quest. Equipment is a special kind of item that provides a boost to one or more stats. You can only wear one of each type of equipment at a time - for example, one cloak, one sword, one pair of boots, and so on. Over time, you can buy better equipment and earn new equipment by completing quests. To put on your new equipment, click Profile in the menu above, and then click the name of the item.
fields.title: A Fresh Start

fields.description: As you enter the town, you see a bright light appear over one of the houses. It takes you a few moments to realize what you're seeing: fire! You rush through the unfamiliar streets until you reach the house's gates. By now the flames have grown greatly and are threatening the other wooden buildings nearby. A short man wearing an elegant tunic is throwing water from a nearby well onto the blaze, but it shows little sign of subsiding.
fields.title: A Fiery Blaze

fields.description: The well-dressed man who led the fight against the house fire drinks by himself in the tavern.
fields.title: Meeting with Trindan

fields.description: You spot Trindan sitting in the tavern, shouting angrily at a larger, chagrined man.
fields.title: Trindan's Search Continues

fields.description: Trindan has asked you to help him determine who the saboteurs are working for and what they hope to accomplish. You will need to gather sufficient evidence in order to piece together a picture of what they are up to. Each time you succeed in one of your choices, you will acquire more evidence. Once you reach 10 pieces of evidence, you can return to Trindan and share your findings.
fields.title: Investigating the Saboteurs

fields.description: Trindan needs sufficient evidence to pursue his case against the saboteurs.
fields.title: Reporting to Trindan

fields.description: Trindan has developed several leads that may help lead you to the men from Gol who have been sending agents to their agents.
fields.title: Tracking the Saboteurs' Masters

fields.description: Discovering the saboteurs' base of operation will require careful observation.
fields.title: Finding the Hideout

fields.description: You've discovered the location of the hideout that Trindan's saboteurs were using.
fields.title: Scouting the Hideout

fields.description: You have only the vaguest information available: Trindan kept a secret cave somewhere in this area, and used it to meet with his fellow agents from House Hansa.
fields.title: Hunting for Trindan's Cave

fields.description: This is the house Trindan had indicated on his map. It either contains his fellow-agents, or the men he was hunting.
fields.title: A Marked Building

fields.description: Ettan has a subtle but active underworld of thieves, confidence tricksters, and other associated persons of intrigue. A bartender lets slip that one of them is looking for a dextrous lockpicker to help with a big job.
fields.title: A Big Score

fields.description: Green Haron's gang have found a door with no knob or pull visible. If you can find your way inside, you can split the spoils with them.
fields.title: Entering a Closet

fields.description: While most of Mad Sigar's mansion is a large contiguous mess, a few areas seem to be accessible only from their own exterior doors. Perhaps he hadn't finished connecting them to the rest of his sprawl before passing.
fields.title: Breaking In

fields.description: Mad Sigar spent a great deal of time, and even more wealth, digging a vast network of tunnels that connected the various structures of his "mansion." As if their labyrinthine design wasn't bad enough, he left cunning traps everywhere, apparently to "thwart the ether."
fields.title: Navigating a Trapped Tunnel

fields.description: Mad Sigar's Mansion varies wildly in height, from low-slung homes to a towering… tower that rises twenty stories high. Sigar ate all his meals at the top of the tower, and constructed a system of dumbwaiters to elevate his food. He also filled the dumbwaiter shafts with traps, such that anyone other than himself who tried to manipulate them would swiftly encounter a ball of flame rushing down the shaft.
fields.title: Death from Above

fields.description: Sigar clearly was obsessed with the ether. His mansion contains a dozen libraries, each of which holds scores of bookcases, each crammed with tomes about the ether. Green Haron believes that many of these libraries conceal entrances to still more hidden rooms within the mansion.
fields.title: Secret Passages

fields.description: Emboldened by your work, the gang of thieves have managed to locate the main vault at the heart of Mad Sigar's mansion. Green Haron himself has asked you to help them crack open the vault door. This will conclude the current phase of the mansion storyline.
fields.title: Entering the Vault

fields.description: It's hard to avoid the mansion near the center of Ettan. More of a complex than a building, it sprawls across several city blocks, displaying wildly diverging architectural styles and a slapdash sense of congruity.
fields.title: An Ethereal Mansion

fields.description: A merchant needs to contact her timber suppliers in Engoth. She offers to pay your carriage fare if you will deliver it for her.
fields.title: Engoth Courier

fields.description: You have been feeling a little poorly lately. Keep an eye on your health. Health will diminish when you lose at battles, fail certain high-level scenarios, and occasionally in response to certain choices. If your health ever reaches 0, you will need to spend time in recovery before you can resume adventuring. Take advantage of scenarios like this to restore your health
fields.title: Recuperation

fields.description: You've been feeling a little poorly lately.
fields.title: Rest at an Inn

fields.description: You've felt a little poorly lately. Perhaps a nice big meal will help your road to recovery.
fields.title: A Sumptuous Repast

fields.description: Trindan's compatriots had suggested that you report to the Patriarch of Hansa. Now would be as good a time as any.
fields.title: Reporting Trindan's Demise

fields.description: You have fulfilled Trindan's professional obligations to the Patriarch. He has asked you to fulfill his personal obligations to the agent's widow.
fields.title: Console Trindan's Widow

fields.description: The widow Poria has stopped receiving notifications from Trindan's network of informants. Can you help her re-activate one of the agents for her?
fields.title: Assisting Agents

fields.description: Poria has sent word through one of the agents you reactivated: something big is coming.
fields.title: A New Threat

fields.description: The diplomatic delegation from House Gol has entered the Great House. Soon they will enter the chambers of the Patriarch. You spy the one who Poria claimed was an assassin: the man holding House Gol's banner, dressed in ceremonial armor with a supposedly ceremonial blade.
fields.title: Thwarting the Assassination

fields.description: A silent courier stops you on the road and hands you a message.
fields.title: A Secret Message

fields.description: Poria discovered that a group of merchants who recently entered from Naper had originally come from Gol. They have traveled hundreds of miles but don't seem to have bought or sold anything. They may be harboring a new batch of killers.
fields.title: Fresh Assassins

fields.description: One of Poria's informants has a lead for you. "They've been traveling through the woods at night, keeping off the main roads. I'm fairly sure that they're looking for the Patriarch's secret lair. You should make sure they don't have the chance to find it."
fields.title: A Convoy of Killers

fields.description: The Group for the Exploration of Manse Sigar has encountered yet another obstacle in their quest to completely map the mansion: a large portcullis blocking one of the underground tunnels. Sigar included a lever to lift the portcullis, but unhelpfully placed it on the wrong side of the barrier.
fields.title: Lifting a Portcullis

fields.description: Manse Sigar presents a fresh challenge to the mapping team. A solid metal door in the great tower has a plain handle, which does not help with opening the deadbolt that can only be opened from the other side of the door.
fields.title: Defeating a Deadbolt

fields.description: The mapping team has returned to the underground catacombs of Sigar's mansion. They are currently stymied by a mound of rubble that fills a hairpin turn.
fields.title: Moving a Barrier

fields.description: The mansion presents a fresh challenge to the mapping group. In his last years, Mad Sigar filled the most remote regions of his complex with deadly traps. The team estimates that this single room alone contains no fewer than thirty traps, all with extremely sensitive triggers, any of which could kill an unwary explorer.
fields.title: Remotely Springing Traps

fields.description: The founder of the Group of the Exploration of Manse Sigar has made a disturbing discovery. "A gang of thieves has been stealing from right under our noses! It may be Green Haron, or one of his rivals. They're taking away precious antiquities that should be preserved for the ages, not sold for a handful of royals!"
fields.title: Driving Away Thieves

fields.description: The map of Sigar Mansion is practically complete. The completed documents reveal that there must be a hidden room at the very center of the great tower. They haven't yet managed to find an entrance, but suspect that Sigar crafted a puzzle from a mosaic that fills an adjacent wall.
fields.title: The Puzzle Box

fields.description: A traveler approaches you. "You look like the sort of #MAN_WOMAN# who knows how to find things. You might be interested in this map. I bought it off a man whose ancestor helped bury the wealth of House Forcan during the King's War. The map is sadly faded, and nobody can read the labels anymore, but if you can find the landmarks in Lok it shows, you may be able to discover its great wealth."
fields.title: Hunting Treasure

fields.description: In order to get oriented for the treasure hunt, you'll need to look for the landmarks the map shows.
fields.title: Finding Landmarks

fields.description: The treasure map still faintly shows signs of a few routes, mostly running between the established landmarks. A few other routes bypass the landmarks altogether.
fields.title: Locating Routes

fields.description: You suddenly realize that a woman has been shadowing your steps for several blocks. You stop and turn around. She walks past, silently handing you a note as she does so. It reads, "Meet me at the inn in one hour."
fields.title: Secret Mission

fields.description: If you're going to get inside, you'll want to get to know the lay of the land: the main doors, the side doors, the windows that can be climbed to, the windows that can safely be jumped from in case of emergency.
fields.title: Scout the Entrances to the Great House

fields.description: You receive a note. "#TITLE_NAME#, please deliver the enclosed royals to the captain of the guard presently on duty. She will ease operations for us later on. You may keep some as payment."
fields.title: Bribing the Guards

fields.description: You receive another note from your employer. "Take the enclosed message and take it to the private rooms of Gellar, Patriarch Tandan's son. You should find another message in there with the same seal. Switch the messages and destroy the one you find."
fields.title: Replacing Messages

fields.description: Yet another message arrives. "Please return to the son Gellar's room and conceal the attached note somewhere inside. I suggest placing it between the pages of an unread book or under a wardrobe, but pick any place where it's unlikely to be casually discovered. I'm counting on you. Signed, Yalene."
fields.title: Placing a Message

fields.description:
You meet with Yalene to discuss your progress. "I see now that Temor was absolutely correct in his assessment of your skills. Allow me to describe the importance of your actions. Gellar, the son of Patriarch Tandan, will most likely become the new Patriarch after his father's death. While the current Patriarch Tandan has respected the treaties with the Kingdom, his son dreams of glory, and will almost certainly drag Tandan into a war with the Kingdom. Such a war would be disastrous for both parties: Tandan doesn't have the navy necessary to strike at the Kingdom's capital, and the Kingdom lacks the numbers required to win the battle on land."

Yalene hands you a uniform and a satchel. "To avoid this war coming to pass, you must carry out a deception to discredit Gellar. Disguise yourself up as one of Tandan's loyalists from the Kingdom. Claim that the son hired you to incite a war. Patriarch Gellar knows of his son's leanings, but won't tolerate open undermining of his rule. Doing this will save untold lives, for our generation and that of our children."
fields.title: Tandan Betrayal

fields.description: Since arriving in Risapo, you've learned of a Guild of Merchants that represents the economic interests of the city. That group probably includes some useful people to know.
fields.title: Tandan Policies

fields.description: Before proceeding too far in your campaign for trade reform, it might be wise to speak with those who buy and sell goods through the Risapo port and see how a change in policy would affect them.
fields.title: Interview Merchants

fields.description: If Tandan were to open its port to cargo from Kingdom lands, would today's ships be willing to make the journey?
fields.title: Talk with Sea-Captains

fields.description: Word has started circulating in Risapo about opening the port to Kingdom ships, sparking an overwhelmingly negative response among veterans, those from near the Kingdom border, and other passionate Tandan partisans.
fields.title: Defend Policy Changes to Anti-Kingdom Zealots

fields.description: Despite no sea routes currently running between Risapo and Soronin, the Kingdom is a crucial supplier to Tandan craftsmen. Some of the wealthiest traders in Risapo are Kingdom ex-patriots who run the overland trade routes.
fields.title: Lobby Kingdom Merchants

fields.description: With the various stakeholders more or less on your side, it's time to begin lobbying those who will actually help implement a change in trade policy: the advisers of Patriarch Tandan.
fields.title: Great Hall Persuassion

fields.description: Tandan has finally summoned you to the Great Hall for a five-minute audience. It's time to put forth your best case.
fields.title: An Audience with Patriarch Tandan

fields.description: Whoever first created this map must have traveled this same land, hundreds of years ago. He or she would have needed to leave behind trailsigns along the way.
fields.title: Discovering Trailsigns

fields.description: Great treasures like House Forcan's don't simply disappear. Other people must know about the treasure, and over the years some of them must have also tried to find it.
fields.title: Tracking the Trackers

fields.description: You think that you may be close to the treasure site. How can you find the actual location, though?
fields.title: Narrowing the Search

fields.description: At last, you think you have found where House Forcan's ancient treasure was buried. Or at least the general area.
fields.title: The Big Dig

fields.description: The Patriarch's silence has continued for some time.
fields.title: Visit the Reclusive Patriarch

fields.description: Neither you nor Poria have heard from the Patriarch in some time.
fields.title: No Word

fields.description: The Patriarch has likely returned to Ettan by now.
fields.title: A Step Beyond

fields.description: You've learned to take advantage of any collection of books that's even marginally available to the public. This one belongs to a somewhat doddering but kindly man inordinately proud of showing off his collection.
fields.title: A New Library

fields.description: If you're going to learn about the First Etherist, you might as well start by learning about Etherists in general.
fields.title: Find a Book about Etherists

fields.description: The First Etherist seems to be quite old. Perhaps he or she never actually existed, or existed as a creature of legend?
fields.title: Read a Book on Legends

fields.description: The Lyceum, a school of etherists located in the Kingdom, may be able to help explain the origins of the First Etherist.
fields.title: Research the Lyceum

fields.description: You increasingly get the impression that the First Etherist has some connection to the Kingdom, although the nature of that relationship remains unclear. Which presents a good topic for study: for how long has the Kingdom been a welcoming environment for etherists?
fields.title: Investigating Etherists and the Kingdom

fields.description: There are few etherists, and most of them have enormous egos. A considerable amount of an etherist's attention is devoted to embarrassing his rivals.
fields.title: Delve into Rivalries

fields.description: The last few books you've read have included "The Life of Sonomin" in their bibliographies. While it isn't directly cited in any of them, it may be worth adding to your list.
fields.title: Track Down Sonomin's Biography

fields.description: You and a poacher surprise one another in the woods. He has just killed a deer, a capital crime. He will gladly kill you as well to ensure no witness remains.
fields.title: Poacher Violence

fields.description: A thief attempts to cut your purse free. When you yell, he releases the purse and lunges at you instead.
fields.title: Fighting a Thief

fields.description: A loud roar alerts you, too late, that you have stepped between a bear and its cub. Too late for apologies now, the beast means to kill you.
fields.title: A Bear

fields.description: A man flags you down. "Excuse me, but you look like a traveler. Might you be going to House Tandan territory in the future? If so, please be so kind as to deliver this letter to my betrothed."
fields.title: The Way to Tandan

fields.description: That looks like the young woman you were sent to meet.
fields.title: Deliver a Love Letter

fields.description: A young lady is selling flowers to passers-by. "Can I interest you in any of these fine blossoms?"
fields.title: Flower Girl

fields.description: A young man hunches over a sheet of paper, working it with a piece of graphite. When your shadow falls over him, he looks up and smiles. "Hullo there. I'm just practicing my sketches. Say, you wouldn't be interested in commissioning something, would you? I could use the practice and the coin."
fields.title: Sketcher

fields.description: A bard in the tavern is taking requests. Is there anything you would care to hear in exchange for a few coins?
fields.title: Bardsong

fields.description: A traveling carnival has set up its pavilions nearby. Do you want to participate?
fields.title: Carnival!

fields.description: A wild-eyed  man in the street is distributing some sort of leaflet. He seems terribly upset about... the weather? Etherists? Pirates? It isn't exactly clear. Still, he's passionate about whatever it is, and implores you to help him spread the word.
fields.title: Sedition

fields.description: A wealthy landowner maintains a luxurious "farm" nearby, primarily to serve as a refuge for his family and friends. He is looking for workers to keep it looking nice.
fields.title: Sprucing Up an Estate

fields.description: Several men and women are gambling on the roll of the dice. Are you feeling lucky?
fields.title: A Dice Game

fields.description: This port town teems with opportunities for commerce. Most of that commerce flows through a loose guild of merchants known as the cartel.
fields.title: Joining the Risapo Cartel

fields.description: A recent ship in from Ronnera contains a cargo of exotic-looking carved animals.
fields.title: Purchasing Island Stone Carvings

fields.description: The residents of this town seem to have an appreciation for pretty, exotic goods.
fields.title: Selling Island Stone Carvings

fields.description: The farms in Naper produce a great deal of wheat. Farmers will accept payment now for a delivery later.
fields.title: Purchasing Wheat Orders

fields.description: Risapo has a large population. Too large for its own farms to feed. It relies on grain and meat delivered from neighboring areas, and will pay decently well.
fields.title: Selling Wheat

fields.description: House Hansa lies on the far side of Tanalga River, a vast and swiftly-moving river. You'll need to hire a ferry to cross it.
fields.title: Onward to Hansa

fields.description: The smithy is offering a discount for customers ordering a whole lot of swords.
fields.title: Bulk Swords

fields.description: The Risapo city guard has begun training a new batch of recruits. They'll need some blades to practice with, but they don't need to be very high quality.
fields.title: Arming the Guard

fields.description: You've demonstrated your skill in bringing commerce through Risapo. It's time to seek recognition for your efforts.
fields.title: Cartel Membership

fields.description: Risapo has a thriving scene of weavers who produce beautiful tapestries.
fields.title: A Sale on Tapestries

fields.description: The residents of this town have an appreciation for fine arts, and rarely are visited by merchants who can supply it.
fields.title: Parting with a Tapestry

fields.description: The retiring adventurer has another task for you. "Ten years ago, I agreed to retrieve a stolen map to House Forcan's treasure. The thief pleaded for his life, and I let him live. He was so thankful that he swore he would become a bard, and would travel the land singing of my kindness. Please find this man and listen to his song, so my children will know their father was a generous man."
fields.title: An Act of Kindness

fields.description: The retiring adventurer is furious at the deceit from the man whose life he spared. "Make him stop! Perhaps I should have killed him myself those years ago. I don't care how you go about it, just ensure that my children don't hear their father's name besmirched!"
fields.title: Creating History

fields.description: The retiring adventurer wishes to thank you for your help, and offers you a choice of rewards.
fields.title: A Legacy Secured

fields.description: The Matron of Tummon is upset about a new arrival in town. "She bought old Florence's cottage, and got rid of all her pretty geraniums! She shuts herself up in there all day long, only comes out at night for meals at the tavern, and never has any visitors. She's up to no good!"
fields.title: An Unwanted Visitor

fields.description: Tummon's latest arrival is secretly an etherist. The matron wants her gone. What will you do?
fields.title: Decide How to Handle the Visiting Etherist

fields.description: The etherist has been working on constructing a laboratory, and is asking you to help her out.
fields.title: Visit the Etherist

fields.description: You won't get better if you lie in bed all day.
fields.title: Move Around

fields.description: Someone of your stature should not need to wait among the rest of this injured rabble.
fields.title: Special Assistance

fields.description: While Mercy Home looks after everyone within its walls, those who are generous with their coin may find closer attention paid.
fields.title: Extra Attention

fields.description: The Mercy Home tries to keep plenty of healing supplies on hand, although their stock gets low occasionally.
fields.title: Taking Medicine

fields.description: A courier taps you on the shoulder. "Have you a moment, #TITLE_NAME#? My employer would like a word."
fields.title: Intrigue in the Great House

fields.description: Pell warned you that, to pull off the deception, you'll need to acquire some garments of Dall's.
fields.title: Invading Dall's Suite

fields.description: Pell will be pleased with your disguise. Now it's time to try it out on the public.
fields.title: Impersonating Dall

fields.description: Pell has coached you in Dall's speaking habits. Of course, your timbre doesn't match his, but that can be explained away by claiming illness. It's time to see how good your impersonation is.
fields.title: Playing Dall

fields.description: One of Dall's advisors has sent an urgent message: the armies are preparing to march back to Gamanar to support his claim.
fields.title: A Midnight Conference

fields.description: The head of the Risapo Cartel wishes to speak with you. Something about trade on a grand scale.
fields.title: Cartel Action

fields.description: You bump into a man on the path. His pack drops to the ground and bursts open, spilling its contents across the ground. Contraband! The man has been smuggling goods and evading the Patriarch's taxation. He pulls out a sling and begins whirling it above his head.
fields.title: Surprised Smuggler

fields.description: You recognize one of the saboteurs! Some evidently escaped Trindan's assault. They know you now, and must be hunting you. He raises a cruel-looking sword over his head and shrieks loudly while advancing toward you.
fields.title: Renegade Saboteur

fields.description: A highwayman has blocked off the road up ahead, and is extracting a "tax" from anyone seeking to pass.
fields.title: False Tolls

fields.description: You've heard rumors that a young child has gone missing. Someone important.
fields.title: Lost Child

fields.description: Gell of House Gol spent several days here before he vanished. There may be some signs of his departure.
fields.title: Searching for Clues

fields.description: Your search for Gell of House Gol takes you to the area outside the camp.
fields.title: Prowling the Perimeter

fields.description: Gell can't have gone too far from the camp without being noticed.
fields.title: Search the Countryside

fields.description: Some fairly fresh bootprints have led you to a rocky outcropping.
fields.title: Investigate a Cave

fields.description: You spy two shapes moving in the distance. One large, one small. The large shape seems to be marching the smaller one forward. Could this be Gell and his kidnapper?
fields.title: Quarry in Sight

fields.description: You stop abruptly and stare at the tracks in front of you. Two sets of prints moving forward. A single, larger set returning.
fields.title: A Lone Figure

fields.description: Gell has probably returned to his father by now. Once the two of them have finished catching up, you should see what Dall has to say about the experience.
fields.title: Dall Debriefing

fields.description: The Great House in Gol constantly buzzes with rumors, theories, and plans. Seemingly everyone has been sworn to secrecy, and can't resist sharing what they know. Lately, many have whispered about a play that Pell might be making for the seat of the Patriarch.
fields.title: A New Campaign

fields.description: Hansa's climate is well-suited for growing sugarcane. You should be able to acquire it in bulk here.
fields.title: Acquiring Sugar

fields.description: Naper's residents haven't traditionally eaten much sugar, but sweets have recently come into vogue.
fields.title: Selling Sugar

fields.description: Like any House of a certain size, Gol relies on a variety of functionaries to execute the tasks of governance.
fields.title: Navigating the Bureaucracy

fields.description: Many of Gol's domestic officials lean toward supporting Pell already, but opinions from the foreign staff are more mixed.
fields.title: Diplomacy

fields.description: Gamanar's revenue office collects taxes, import fees, and other income for Gol. Its revenuers have a fair amount of influence over the decisions made in the Great House.
fields.title: A Talk with the Tax-Man

fields.description: Like all Houses, Gol features a bewildering array of nephews, cousins, grandsons, and distant relatives to the Patriarch. Those with the closest relation to the Patriarch almost invariably wield the most influence and receive the most important posts, but any man with a provable relation to the Patriarch is more significant than the most important man with no relation.
fields.title: The Gol Family Tree

fields.description: Dall has recently begun voicing his opinions on foreign policy. It's time to exploit his blunders for Pell's gains.
fields.title: Discrediting Dall

fields.description: You've gained the ears of enough powerful figures in Gol. It's time to make a case for the question of succession.
fields.title: The Succession

fields.description: You've gained a certain standing among the traders in Risapo. It's time to exploit that standing in favor of the Cartel's initiative.
fields.title: Well-Placed Insults

fields.description: You've already gotten to know some of Naper's wheat farmers. It's time to see if their product can be moved east as easily as south.
fields.title: More Wheat

fields.description: Hansa has rarely purchased wheat from Naper. Hopefully this means you're ahead of the curve, and not pursuing a foolish venture.
fields.title: Unload Wheat

fields.description: Your actions on behalf of the Risapo Cartel have not gone unnoticed. It's time to collect your appreciation.
fields.title: The Great Realignment

fields.description: House Gol keeps its ancient artifacts of sovereignty - silver crowns, bejeweled scepters - deep within the vaults beneath Gamanar. In an effort to boost pride in the House, the Patriarch planned to put these priceless baubles on a rare public display for all to see.
fields.title: Rare Exhibition

fields.description: The mint only has three doors, but it's a very large building with many windows. They might be tempting targets for aspiring intruders.
fields.title: Casing the Windows

fields.description: House Gol doesn't want the commoners rubbing their grubby hands over the precious artifacts, so they will be placing their jewels inside display cases. These sturdy boxes are largely built from glass to allow easy viewing, but have been reinforced with metal for greater security.
fields.title: Securing Displays

fields.description: The watchmen who patrol the old mint building are a line of defense against intruders, but also a potential weakness. Each carries a set of keys with them, and someone who lifts those keys could simply unlock the doors meant to bar their entry.
fields.title: Pocket Picking

fields.description: While you've helped narrow down the opportunities for larceny, a determined thief will probably still eventually get inside. You intend to have a surprise waiting for them.
fields.title: Laying Traps

fields.description: You've been thinking about the display cases. Someone who works for long enough will eventually get inside them. What if you could create one last line of defense within those cases?
fields.title: Case Modification

fields.description: House Gol has felt increasingly sure about the safety of its exhibit, thanks to your efforts, and is preparing to bring the artifacts in and open the museum to the public.
fields.title: The Big Score

fields.description: You've become fairly well acquainted with the capabilities of ether. You're reaching the end of what you can learn on your own, though. You should find a skilled instructor if you wish to progress in your capabilities.
fields.title: A New Avenue of Power

fields.description: Yanofol seems every bit as crazy as the Tummon etherist had said, if not more so. "You wish to know of ether, do you?! Let's see how well you can learn whilst I hurl these pieces of fruit at your skull!"
fields.title: Duck!

fields.description: The etherist Yanofol seems particularly worked up today. "My neighbors! They put up a fence AGAIN! After I specifically tore down the last one! They'll pay! They'll all pay! Knock it down for me! Knock it down so hard that they know it must stay down!"
fields.title: Bad Neighbors

fields.description: For a man who seems to be at least a hundred angry years old, Yanofol is regularly surprised by objects that he's doubtless seen many times before. "What's that?! Wretched creature! Four legs, but no dog? How dare it! Let's teach it a lesson! Send it back to the volcano!" He… he seems to have developed a distaste for this particular cat.
fields.title: Scaring a Cat

fields.description: Yanofol's antics would grate even the most patient #MAN_WOMAN#. Perhaps it's time to give him some of his own medicine.
fields.title: Turn the Tables

fields.description: Yanofol seems somewhat subdued, a rare state for him to occupy. "The neighbors seem upset with me for some reason. I can't begin to imagine why. I'm going to have them over for dinner tonight to try and work it out. I'd like to impress them; would you be so kind as to set the table before we sit down? Using the ether, of course."
fields.title: Set the Table

fields.description: Yanofol stalks up to you, sneering in your face. "Think you're good? Thank you've got what it takes? Pfah! Everything you know comes from me! I contain you! I could beat you any day? Wanna bet?" Curious onlookers are starting to murmur with one another. This doesn't seem to be the first time Yanofol has issued such  challenge, and a betting pool is swiftly forming.
fields.title: The Contest

fields.description: You have learned a great deal about ether and its mysteries during your time in Skal. You seem to be reaching the limits of what you can learn on your own, though. It may be time to start thinking about collaborating with others in your quest for knowledge.
fields.title: Continuing Education

fields.description: You have heard others often use the wind to help explain the ether. But how exactly are the two related? Is ether a cause, or a medium, or something else entirely?
fields.title: Considering the Wind

fields.description: Does ether only exist within the air? Or could one also find it underwater? If so, would it behave any differently from the ether that surrounds people?
fields.title: Pondering Water

fields.description: Creatures have some intelligence of their own. Are they capable of using ether? Does it affect them differently than humans?
fields.title: Playing with Animals

fields.description: There are many different materials in the world, all existing surrounded by ether. How does ether affect them?
fields.title: Defining "Solid"

fields.description: Your investigations so far have mostly focused on the everyday faces of nature. What of its rare furies? What of fire, lightning, and other disasters?
fields.title: Natural Disasters

fields.description: You have acquired a tentative but plausible understanding of how ether affects, and is affected by, nature. You can now prove or disprove your theories with an experimental project.
fields.title: No Stone Unturned

fields.description: A glowering villain has tired of waiting for an army to hire him, and plans to make some money off your corpse.
fields.title: Mercenary

fields.description: A surly guard plants himself in front of you and demands that you pay the breathing tax.
fields.title: Civic Corruption

fields.description: A gang of marauding pirates have struck far inland in their quest for plunder.
fields.title: Unlikely Pirates

fields.description: Someone has been spreading a rumor that you're an etherist. Some locals have armed themselves with rocks and decided to punish you with death.
fields.title: Angry Mob

fields.description: A raider from Forcan is bludgeoning everyone in sight and taking their royals. Whether he is the vanguard for an invasion, or simply out to make some coin, he must be dealt with.
fields.title: Forcan Raider

fields.description: You seem to have made an enemy somewhere along the way. Perhaps more than one. Someone has put a bounty on your head, and this killer means to collect it.
fields.title: Assassin

fields.description: A pack of hungry hyenas eye you greedily, thinking of their next meal.
fields.title: Hyenas

fields.description: A few prisoners have escaped from a nearby jail. They look half-starved, but what they lack in strength they make up for in desperation.
fields.title: Prisoners

fields.description: Rumors of your larceny have gotten around, and the local militia would like a little, violent word with you.
fields.title: The Law

fields.description: You interrupt a meeting between two hooded men, who seemed to be discussing a planned invasion. You didn't catch the whole conversation, but they look prepared to kill you to ensure their secret remains safe.
fields.title: Spies

fields.description: A #MAN_WOMAN# of your stature inevitably attracts people who want some of your fame. Some will try to get fame by following you. Others will try to become famous by killing you. This is one of the latter.
fields.title: A New Challenger Appears

fields.description: Chase down the slowest of the herd. This will provide plenty of food for your journey!
fields.title: Dinner's On

fields.description: The buck in front sports a magnificent rack. It will be hard to take this one, and doing so will prove your hunting prowess.
fields.title: A Fine Trophy

fields.description: What did the deer ever do to you?
fields.title: Let Them Pass

fields.description: You're outnumbered here. Best to keep quiet and not do anything rash.
fields.title: Observe the Fray

fields.description: Now's the time for action. A swift display of force will make them think twice about their actions.
fields.title: Rescue the Lad

fields.description: In your experience, it doesn't take much to change the focus of an angry mob.
fields.title: Create a Distraction

fields.description: That's what a lockpick is for, right?
fields.title: Pick the Lock

fields.description: May tales of your exploits spread throughout the land!
fields.title: Wish for Fame

fields.description: The world has plenty. You deserve some.
fields.title: Wish for Wealth

fields.description: Many wise people study the stars, so they must have secrets worth knowing.
fields.title: Wish for Wisdom

fields.description: Why strive? Enjoy the time you have.
fields.title: Wish for Happiness

fields.description: Not enough royals for full instruction? For the price of a flagon of ale, he will give you a few tips.
fields.title: A brief lesson

fields.description: Too few people in Skal know the Ether's mysteries, and even fewer are willing to share its secrets. Learn as much as you can from this opportunity.
fields.title: A full course

fields.description: So he thinks he can teach you of the Ether, does he? Let there be a contest of powers between you! The victor shall win a respectable purse with the spoils!
fields.title: A contest

fields.description: Surely the beast will return, and when it does, you shall be ready.
fields.title: Lay a Trap

fields.description: The man leaning against the bar has bright red hair, a bushy beard, and no fingers. He claims to have fought in the Tanalga River War, and have tales that will chill your spine.
fields.title: Listen to a Wounded Veteran

fields.description: Judging from the guffaws emerging from the well-lit corner, this heavy-lidded man is more amusing than he looks.
fields.title: Listen to a Jovial Jokester

fields.description: Several women gathered around a table are exchanging market information in intense but quiet conversation. Such people don't take kindly to interlopers.
fields.title: Listen to the Well-Informed Traders

fields.description: With peoples' attentions so distracted, it would take little effort to relieve them of their burdensome purses.
fields.title: Work the Crowd

fields.description: It may take most of the day, but you can't abide the thought of these children wandering around unattended.
fields.title: Escort them home

fields.description: Your time is valuable! You intend to keep track of the hours spent in the search, so you can politely close up accounts with their father later.
fields.title: Escort them home... for a price

fields.description: Sure, it looks dangerous; that's why their previous owner left them here. A little water's nothing to be afraid of. How about a lot of water?
fields.title: Make a dive

fields.description: No, there's no compelling reason to climb it... but that's not about to stop you!
fields.title: Because It's There

fields.description: If you take your time, you probably won't reach the summit by nightfall... but you will probably enjoy the climb more.
fields.title: Climb Slowly and Carefully

fields.description: The farmer hasn't had much luck with his old shortbow, but perhaps your eyes and reflexes will serve you better. If you can shoot a few of the scavengers, the rest should get the message.
fields.title: Hail of Arrows

fields.description: The stationary scarecrow doesn't seem to be making any impact. Perhaps if you wheel around and holler loudly, you can frighten them off.
fields.title: Flailing and Screaming

fields.description: It feels a little like overkill, but with enough work you should be able to erect a barrier out of the ether that will repel avian intruders.
fields.title: Invisible Dome

fields.description: You've heard that this book's theories have been discredited, but there may still be some worthwhile knowledge hidden amongst the dross.
fields.title: Choose Ethereal Mysteries

fields.description: All the rage when you were growing up, most of this tome's techniques have been well learned by serious swordsmen already, and they are wise to its tricks.
fields.title: Choose an Illustrated Guide to Swordplay

fields.description: No man owning this tome could have ever been truly respectable. This is a guide for aspiring lockpickers, only thinly disguised as a resource for lockbox owners who have thoughtlessly misplaced their keys.
fields.title: Choose Guile's Guide to Locks

fields.description: The adventurer's clues should help you track it down.
fields.title: Locate the Ominous Crossroads

fields.description: It sounds like the man could use your services... assuming you aren't the animal, of course.
fields.title: Volunteer

fields.description: Cows are notoriously large and slow, so even though this particular herd is free-ranging, they shouldn't be too hard to locate.
fields.title: Find Them

fields.description: Few things are as docile and unintelligent as a sheep. Finding them will take persistence, but little skill.
fields.title: Sheep Herder

fields.description: They can be hard to spot in the undergrowth, and you need to be careful to not get skewered by a charging boar. If you can find the herd's lair, though, you should be able to bring plenty of pork back to the butcher.
fields.title: Track a Porker

fields.description: A rabbit's speed, small size, and habitat all make pursuit tricky. You'll need to be especially observant to find some.
fields.title: Warren Chaser

fields.description: If the creature actually exists, it must leave some signs behind. Visit the areas where it was spotted and look for anything unusual.
fields.title: Track the Animal

fields.description: You feel confident that, if you can set aside enough provisions to stake out an area non-stop for several days, you will be able to find the creature. Assuming it actually exists, of course.
fields.title: Capture the Boagar

fields.description: It seems foolish to wait for days in hopes that a possibly-mythical animal appears. On the other hand, the forest is filled with boars, and you can probably find a cougar. A little work with a knife, and you might be able to pull off the scam.
fields.title: Create a Boagar

fields.description: Sam Yole is one of the richest men in town. He owns the largest store, controls shipments, and rents out many dwellings. Much of the town's merchant community backs him, perhaps out of fear.
fields.title: Back the Drygoodsman

fields.description: Peter Barst adventured around Skal for many years before settling down to practice his trade here, and has earned respect throughout the House for the quality of his blades. While the town respects him and his work ethic, many still see him as an outsider.
fields.title: Back the Blacksmith

fields.description: Sam has considerable knowledge about the town's history and culture. You might be able to learn something that will be useful later.
fields.title: Speak with Sam

fields.description: Peter is unusually reticent for someone seeking to rule a village. See if you can draw him out in conversation.
fields.title: Parlay with Peter

fields.description: Spend an hour speaking with the poor, the un-landed, and other minor personages.
fields.title: Canvas in the Village

fields.description: As a general rule, the mercantile class prefers to maintain the status quo. You can encourage that preference and point out the importance of swiftly filling the elder's chair.
fields.title: Point Out the Benefits

fields.description: You spy Descor riding down the thoroughfare. Most people give him a respectful berth, leaving you an opportunity to get close.
fields.title: Waylay in the Street

fields.description: You doubt Descor means to ride all the way back to the Household today. If you keep a low profile, you may be able to find him in a more accessible location.
fields.title: Follow Him

fields.description: Andrew has seen enough of both men to know all their faults. Convince him of the benefits your elder offers.
fields.title: Impress Andrew

fields.description: You have prepared a long list of reasons why Sam Yole will be the most capable and loyal elder. You are also authorized to pay a small bribe, should the opportunity arise.
fields.title: Convince Him to Choose Sam

fields.description: Peter's fame extends beyond the town, and would add to the prestige of the House.
fields.title: Convince Him to Choose Peter

fields.description: You haven't been impressed by Peter's campaigning skills, and Sam has hinted that he will pay you a large bribe if you smooth his path to victory.
fields.title: Switch Allegiance to Sam

fields.description: You've grown increasingly disillusioned with the heavy-handed approach Sam takes to town culture. Peter remains something of an enigma, but he strikes you as a more honest fellow.
fields.title: Switch Allegiance to Peter

fields.description: The local stable has a mare for sale. She looks like a quiet, temperate creature.
fields.title: Buy a Horse

fields.description: The locals have a bad habit of leaving their mounts unattended when they visit the tavern. If you're quick, you might be able to make off with a mount before anyone notices.
fields.title: Steal a Horse

fields.description: Temor is sitting by himself at a low table in the tavern, scratching out a letter and muttering to himself about spies. See if you can glean more information from him.
fields.title: Approach Temor

fields.description: Sam's an easy man to find. Try to remain unseen while lurking in or near his store to see if he is meeting with anyone suspicious.
fields.title: Spy on Sam

fields.description: The huntress is traveling on foot today. See if she meets with anyone suspicious.
fields.title: Shadow Her Trail

fields.description: The lad seems to be about fifteen years old, and has built quite a business for himself by delivering letters, both in town and between villages. See if any of his customers are buying information.
fields.title: Observe the Boy's Meetings

fields.description: The limping adventurer has rented a small but private room over the tavern. If he is corresponding with any enemies of the House, you may be able to find evidence inside.
fields.title: Investigate His Room

fields.description: A steady flow of customers pass in and out of the tavern's doors, and most of them will exchange at least a few words with the mistress. Try to remain unobtrusive and overhear their conversations.
fields.title: Eavesdropping Again

fields.description: The messenger is the most likely suspect: he had access to Temor's information, he regularly travels to other areas, and he has been seen in the company of foreigners.
fields.title: Accuse the Messenger

fields.description: The timing of his arrival seems too fortunate to be a mere coincidence. Adventurers like him have many contacts in foreign lands, and he could have known that the Patriarch's secrets would fetch a high price.
fields.title: Accuse the Limping Adventurer

fields.description: It's risky to accuse a man's lover of crime, so be sure you're confident in your evidence.
fields.title: Accuse the Mistress

fields.description: It looks like he could use the assistance, and you might earn a little bit of coin in the process.
fields.title: Offer to Help Disarm Traps

fields.description: A quick snip should ensure that the animal is released before the trapper returns.
fields.title: Cut the Cord

fields.description: If you gauge the trap's design correctly, you'll have one full second between when the stick breaks and the rock slams into your head. If you can run through, pull the stick, and keep moving without interruption, you should be able to get through it intact.
fields.title: Trigger the Trap

fields.description: By moving carefully and watching the ground closely, you should be able to find the trap without triggering it.
fields.title: Thwart the Trap

fields.description: You've studied enough of the smaller specimens to have some ideas for an effective, and hopefully non-lethal, way to capture a person.
fields.title: Make a Man Trap

fields.description: You can't tell whether the poacher is more afraid of the trap biting his leg, or of you. You'll need to get him free of the trap, and then keep him constrained while marching him to the gamekeeper for questioning.
fields.title: Release the Trap

fields.description: It's an audacious thought, but... what if you developed a synchronized trap? A single trap would alarm the rest of the camp, but if you could somehow set off a trap such that the whole camp was caught at once...
fields.title: A Cunning Plan

fields.description: You spot an agent from House Engoth walking the banks of the river, sketching a map and making notes. See what he's up to.
fields.title: Assess the Agent

fields.description: Most lumberjacks operate wholesale, but you can probably convince them to cut some extra logs for you... for the right price.
fields.title: Purchase Some Lumber

fields.description: If you negotiate carefully, you may be able to come out ahead in the transaction.
fields.title: Negotiate a Price

fields.description: A grizzled miner is dragging a cart to town. See if you can convince him to part with a few rocks.
fields.title: Buy Ore

fields.description: Since the work can't progress until they get supplies, they may pay a premium for any iron you can sell.
fields.title: Sell the Iron

fields.description: The foreman is offering you 50 royals to recruit ten workers. You aren't sure if that will be enough; if it isn't, you'll need to pay the difference from your own pocket.
fields.title: Go Hiring

fields.description: The foreman is skilled at putting together boards and pillars, but has no background in creating the kind of festivities that a Patriarch deserves. Offer your services to make this a memorable occasion.
fields.title: Plan a Party

fields.description: You can't watch yourself while you sleep, so you'll need to ask someone else to do so for you.
fields.title: Recruit an Observer

fields.description: Thus far, most of your ether manifestations have occurred while dreaming. Perhaps you'll be able to observe the mechanisms of ether manipulation in that half-waking state at the start of your day.
fields.title: Self-Check in the Morning

fields.description: If you assemble an appropriate range of objects around your cot at night, maybe their disposition in the morning will tell you something.
fields.title: Lay Out Instruments

fields.description: If you're going to manipulate it, you'll need to find it first.
fields.title: Feel the Ether

fields.description: You need to organize your thoughts, and try to translate sensation into words.
fields.title: Write Some Notes

fields.description: You'll need to convince them that you know their subject well enough to be worth corresponding with.
fields.title: Put Pen to Paper

fields.description: Perhaps, if you focus on thoughts of movement right before falling asleep, you'll be able to move items more reliably.
fields.title: Deliberately Dream

fields.description: You try to travel light, but you have some metal cookware, which you can stuff with dry rations and clothing to make heavier. Can you drag it across the floor while you slumber?
fields.title: Move a Metal Pot

fields.description: Best to practice on something small. Here's a tree; try and grab a leaf without touching it.
fields.title: Pull a Leaf

fields.description: A farmer is looking for workers to help harvest his fields. You have no intention of swinging a sickle, but this could be a useful opportunity to practice your manipulation of the ether.
fields.title: Plow a Field

fields.description: You have a needle and some yarn. How about knitting together a little memento, in tribute to your growing ether powers? The weight shouldn't be a problem, but you'll need to be very precise in your control of the needle.
fields.title: Knit

fields.description: Never mind the motivations behind this tussle. It's a fight, and thus a good opportunity to release some steam and make your name known.
fields.title: Join the Fray

fields.description: He weighs significantly more than you, which would matter if this were a fair fight. If you can get behind him and start pounding, he should go down before he can put up a fight.
fields.title: Jump Martin

fields.description: Glen seems to be taking a break from his customary pummeling and is walking past a lumber pile. Do you dare grab a log and take a swing?
fields.title: Whack Glen

fields.description: Carl proudly owns a pair of blunted maces, and expects the two of you to settle your differences with them. The fight will continue until one of you beg for mercy, and the other feels like stopping.
fields.title: Accept the Challenge

fields.description: She looks experienced with both her longbow and the terrain. You may be able to learn something useful from her.
fields.title: Approach the Woman

fields.description: Stand forty paces from the nearest haystack and take aim.
fields.title: Loose Arrows

fields.description: A lone scarecrow holds court in the middle of a fallow field. This object nicely approximates the size that you are likely to need to hit in the future.
fields.title: Shoot a Scarecrow

fields.description: The largest boar is also the most stationary, and will provide the safest target.
fields.title: Take Aim

fields.description: The pursued are mostly paying attention to their pursuers, and you are positioned well to thwart their escape.
fields.title: Trip a Brigand

fields.description: The soldiers have the conflict well under control. See if they are using any moves you could learn.
fields.title: Watch from Afar

fields.description: You'll be surrounded by seasoned veterans, so this should be a fairly safe way to experience close combat.
fields.title: Pick Up Your Sword

fields.description: Fighting against four men is suicidal, but if you make a loud enough racket and struggle fiercely enough, you may be able to hold out until the professionals arrive.
fields.title: Raise the Alarm and Charge

fields.description: Attack them.
fields.title: Fight!

fields.description: Several carriages are taking people to Naper tomorrow. Once across the border, you will be on your own.
fields.title: Join the Recruits

fields.description: If you have unfinished business here, you can travel to Naper at a later date.
fields.title: Offer to Come Later

fields.description: After coming so near to death, your body requires time and patience for healing. Relax and let time take its course.
fields.title: Rest

fields.description: Skal is waiting for you.
fields.title: Adventure On!

fields.description: Your father was a distant relative to the Patriarch of House Engoth, who lost favor within the family when he married a successful but common-born woman.
fields.title: Minor Nobility

fields.description: Your ancestors have grown crops near the floodplain of the Tanalga River for hundreds of years, surviving the chaos of multiple wars.
fields.title: Hard-working Farmers

fields.description: A humble but reliable trade in cloth allowed your parents to cultivate a fairly cosmopolitan lifestyle, including abodes in multiple cities.
fields.title: Successful Traders

fields.description: Female warriors are rare in Skal, but have grown more common in the centuries since Queen Sebrene ascended the throne. Your mother and father met in opposition on the battlefield, and married after the war ended.
fields.title: Soldiers

fields.description: The pace of innovation within the Kingdom has alarmed many Houses, who have dipped into their coffers to support their own places of learning. Your parents continued to teach at one such school even after its patronage vanished.
fields.title: Teachers
