fields.description: You must have had parents, but never knew them. You were found by strangers at a young age, and have spent most of your childhood fending for yourself in a variety of homes, both indoors and out.
fields.title: Nobody

fields.description: Inside each scenario, you will see one or more choices. Select the choice that most closely matches what you want to do. Since there's only one choice here, just click the button below!
fields.title: Make a Choice

fields.description: You grabbed sticks and friends and re-enacted the epic wars of the past, pretending that you defended against Sedoron's War of Conquest or invaded Talimar.
fields.title: Fighting Imaginary Battles

fields.description: Few books exist in Skal, and you spent your spare time hunting for new ones and learning what you could from them.
fields.title: Reading Books

fields.description: You tested your strength against your friends, and generally triumphed.
fields.title: Wrestling

fields.description: Towns didn't hold much of interest for you, so you traveled into the forests of Skal, drawing maps of your journeys.
fields.title: Went Exploring

fields.description: Your childhood was mostly devoted to play. You found many good hiding spots and learned to conceal yourself well.
fields.title: Played Hide-And-Seek

fields.description: The cloaked and hooded traveler used this map to arrive in your village, and it should serve you well as you leave.
fields.title: Purchase the Map

fields.description: The forests nearby teem with beavers, foxes, and other animals with valuable fur. If you borrow a bow and some arrows, you can collect enough furs to sell.
fields.title: Harvest Furs

fields.description: A nearby vineyard has accidentally grown a crop of table grapes that cannot be used in its wine. You can sell the grapes in the village and keep a small profit for yourself.
fields.title: Sell Grapes

fields.description: Some good-spirited if unwise adults have created a new division for the pre-adolescent crowd. No weapons are allowed. The winner earns a prize purse, and all participants will earn a coin or two.
fields.title: Enter an Amateur Fight

fields.description: Surely these wealthy people won't notice if a coin or two goes missing?
fields.title: Pick Pockets

fields.description: Few can resist the pathetic sight of a small child in need. Playing up the natural sympathies of strangers may earn you a few royals.
fields.title: Beg

fields.description: Spend some time looking over your map to make sure you'll recognize all the landmarks and routes you will encounter.
fields.title: Study Your Map

fields.description: A particularly wild and vicious cougar is threatening the livestock and children of several farms in the countryside. Become their hero by finding the beast.
fields.title: Track a Rabid Cougar

fields.description: Naper is currently at peace, but its Patriarch has been quietly expanding his forces for the past year. If you can prove yourself in combat, you can join their ranks.
fields.title: Join the Army

fields.description: Rumors speak of a shadowy highway that transports goods from Engoth into Naper, bypassing the Patriarch's taxes. You will need to be quiet and cautious to shadow their movements, but such an operation will likely offer many ill-gotten gains.
fields.title: Infiltrate a Smuggling Network

fields.description: Engoth's high mountains boast several streams where gold can be found. Lonely prospectors toil to collect a few grains of the precious yellow dust. Gold reliably fetches a high price in the lowland cities, and you can make a tidy profit by convincing the prospectors to use you as their courier.
fields.title: Enter the Gold Trade

fields.description: Some of the highways crossing the countryside are much older than the founding of the Kingdom, and you can occasionally find ancient markers written in an unfamiliar script. Learning what they mean would increase your reputation, and more importantly, restore lost knowledge to the world.
fields.title: Decipher Cryptic Runes

fields.description: Harvest festivals in the countryside are often accompanied by good-natured competitions between locals and outsiders. Make a name for yourself by tearing down a tree with your bare hands!
fields.title: Demonstrate a Feat of Strength

fields.description: Enter Folls.
fields.title: Carry On

fields.description: Enter Tummon.
fields.title: Carry On

fields.description: Time is critical when fighting a fire, and you need to act quickly.
fields.title: Grab a Bucket and Help

fields.description: Two people stand little chance against a fire. You'll need to recruit more assistance.
fields.title: Raise the Alarm

fields.description: You owe this town of strangers nothing, and a fire is a good show.
fields.title: Watch the Destruction

fields.description: Trindan seemed to have a theory about who caused the fire. He may have a job for you.
fields.title: Introduce Yourself

fields.description: Something new must have developed in his investigation, but what?
fields.title: Approach Him

fields.description: They won't do anything while you're watching them, but they leave signs of their passing wherever they move. They use their cover as timber merchants to spend frequent time in the forest; if you can follow their movements, you'll learn more of their intention.
fields.title: Track the Strangers

fields.description: The three travelers have rented rooms above a grocer. If you have a lockpick and can use it well, you can try to enter while they're gone and search for evidence.
fields.title: Break Into the Strangers' Rooms

fields.description: If you can find one of the three when he's alone, a quick bash on the head should make him quite cooperative in your investigation.
fields.title: Mug a Suspect

fields.description: You have collected a variety of evidence from the three saboteurs. It's time to share your discoveries with Trindan.
fields.title: Share Your Findings

fields.description: Trindan managed to catch one of the three suspects and has imprisoned him in a basement. See if you can convince him to tell you what you need to know.
fields.title: Interrogate a Captive

fields.description: Another suspect is still at large. If you can beat him in a duel, you may be able to squeeze information from him.
fields.title: Defeat an Agent

fields.description: Many of the messages you had gathered earlier seem to be encrypted. Study them and see if you can decipher their meaning.
fields.title: Break the Cipher

fields.description: You have collected a great deal of information about the saboteurs' masters and their movements. You feel that you're getting close to discovering their hideout.
fields.title: Assemble Your Clues

fields.description: The land around the cabin is very quiet, and you don't see any signs of activity from within.
fields.title: Enter the Hideout

fields.description: Try to pick up the trail of the agents and follow it to his hideout.
fields.title: Find the Cave

fields.description: Put out word that you're seeking a spy's cave. If you're sufficiently well-known, the local gamesmen may assist you.
fields.title: Request Aid from Hunters

fields.description: There's only one way to end this. You'll need to step inside.
fields.title: Enter the Safehouse

fields.description: If they need someone badly enough to recruit from outside their ranks, they are probably prepared to pay handsomely.
fields.title: Arrange for an Introduction

fields.description: The door itself is solid, but if you can force a shiv into the gap, you might be able to remove it from the frame.
fields.title: Crack the Hinge

fields.description: You'll need to work quietly to open this door without alerting the city guard.
fields.title: Quickly Pick a Lock

fields.description: A fresh corridor beckons, but Green Haron's gang have grown way of the spikes and bursts of flame likely to greet them. You'll need nimble hands to shut them off.
fields.title: Disarm the Traps

fields.description: The dumbwaiters provide access to a few otherwise impenetrable rooms. Work your way up the shaft walls and deal with any triggering mechanisms you can find.
fields.title: Clear a Shaft

fields.description: Each wall is lined with the things, so they must hold the secret to the way in.
fields.title: Examine the Bookshelves

fields.description: After overcoming the bewildering complexity of the rest of the mansion, one lone door shouldn't prove much of a threat.
fields.title: Assist the Thieves' Entry

fields.description: You deserve a larger share. You'll open the door, all right, but you'll make sure they step through first. If you've learned anything about Mad Sigar, it's that he didn't believe in having two exits to a room.
fields.title: Trap the Thieves Inside

fields.description: You don't believe that House Hansa or Sigar's heirs have even noticed yet that much of their wealth has disappeared. Turning them in may not be very profitable, but could provide some useful connections.
fields.title: Betray the Thieves to the Authorities

fields.description: You can't exactly identify why, but something about the mansion seems strongly evocative of what you've learned of the Ether.
fields.title: Inquire about the Mansion

fields.description: This won't pay well after expenses, but will help you expand your horizons significantly.
fields.title: Accept the commission

fields.description: Take it easy, avoid strenuous activities, and hope that healing follows.
fields.title: Spend a day in rest

fields.description: Sleeping outside every night can't be too healthy.
fields.title: Rent a Common Bunk

fields.description: The inn promises greater luxury for those with more coin to spend.
fields.title: Rent a Private Room

fields.description: You've laid aside a good cache of provisions, and it's time to enjoy them.
fields.title: Feast

fields.description: You still have a few papers from Trindan that may help establish your credentials.
fields.title: Apply for an Audience

fields.description: She hasn't been receiving visitors, but may agree to see you.
fields.title: Call on the Widow

fields.description: If you can shadow the agent for long enough, you may be able to collect embarrassing information that you could use to your advantage.
fields.title: Blackmail an Informant

fields.description: The agents often need hired muscle to extract a confession or rescue them from unpleasantness. If you help one out of a jam, you can claim a favor later.
fields.title: Assist an Informant

fields.description: Her news must be urgent for her to risk the secrecy of her agents.
fields.title: Visit Poria

fields.description: The risk of letting him enter the Patriarch's presence is too great.
fields.title: Attack the Bannerman

fields.description: If he's an assassin, he has likely done the same in the past. Turnabout is only fair.
fields.title: Stab the Bannerman in the back

fields.description: They certainly don't view this honor guard as a threat. Convincing them otherwise will require some fast talking.
fields.title: Sway the Guards

fields.description: There's no writing on the outside, but the seal looks familiar….
fields.title: Read the note.

fields.description: If you can project a sufficient threat, you might be able to prevent them from carrying out their plan.
fields.title: Intimidate the Merchants

fields.description: They will be traveling down this road in less than an hour. Plenty of time to construct some caltrops and put them to use.
fields.title: Set a Trap for the Merchants

fields.description: They outnumber you, but you can claim the advantage of distance.
fields.title: Lay an Ambush

fields.description: They sleep during the day, which will make your approach difficult.
fields.title: Infiltrate their Camp

fields.description: You have a clear line of sight to the lever, and may be able to tug at it through the ether.
fields.title: Pull the Lever

fields.description: There's no keyhole in the door, so even with the ether you'll need to find some way to reach the other side of the door.
fields.title: Turn the Lock

fields.description: The twists of the narrow corridor make it impossible to gain sufficient leverage over the rubble through traditional physical means. You'll need to somehow jar it loose through ether.
fields.title: Shift the Rubble

fields.description: "Instead of pulling on one particular object, can you pull at everything within the room? That could set off the traps while keeping us safe from harm."
fields.title: Sweep the Room for Traps

fields.description: The Group is useless in a fight. You'll need to find a creative way to drive the thieves off.
fields.title: Scare the Intruders

fields.description: The arrangement of tiles makes you think that it was initially constructed with the assistance of ether manipulation. Perhaps your own skills can find the way open.
fields.title: Solve the Puzzle

fields.description: "There's sure to be hundreds of pre-Kingdom coins in there! This will be the best investment you'll ever make! I'd do it myself, but I'm tired of wandering all over Lok looking for the thing."
fields.title: Buy the Map

fields.description: You have a wide territory to cover, but the symbols look fairly distinctive. You should know one when you see it.
fields.title: Hunt for Landmarks

fields.description: The map is several hundred years old, but the routes were most likely based off existing paths or animal trails. With luck, some still survive today.
fields.title: Find a Trailhead

fields.description: This sounds like it could lead to something interesting...
fields.title: Make the Meeting

fields.description: You'll need to avoid the guards unless you want to be picked up for loitering.
fields.title: Look Around

fields.description: The captain rarely ventures outside the gates, so you'll need to go in. Hopefully you can pass it to her without appearing too obvious.
fields.title: Deliver the Bribe

fields.description: Getting into Gellar's chambers may be challenging, but the switch itself seems straightforward.
fields.title: Switch the Messages

fields.description: It will be very difficult to read the messages without breaking the seals, but you may learn something useful if you succeed.
fields.title: Read the Messages Before Switching

fields.description: Hiding the message will take a while, and you'll need to stay quiet throughout.
fields.title: Plant the Note

fields.description: Seek an audience with the Patriarch and claim that his son is a traitor.
fields.title: Carry Out Yalene's Deception

fields.description: Tell Gellar about Yalene's conspiracy to remove him from power.
fields.title: Reveal Yalene's Plot to Gellar

fields.description: The merchants gather in a large, lavishly appointed hall at the west of town within view of the port.
fields.title: Call on the Guild

fields.description: The traders here are bound to have opinions.
fields.title: Ask at the Port

fields.description: You may be able to convince the captain that more work would benefit them.
fields.title: Find a Merchant Ship

fields.description: This contingent could scuttle the whole movement unless you head it off soon.
fields.title: Calm Their Passions

fields.description: These people potentially have the most to lose if the port opens, since they will lose their control over the supply of Kingdom goods.
fields.title: Promote the Changes

fields.description: Many offices oversee port activity in one role or another, and any of them could aid or thwart your suit.
fields.title: Speak with an Official

fields.description: Lay out your arguments as convincingly as possible.
fields.title: Convince Tandan to Allow Open Trade

fields.description: Finding the original map creator's marks will help you orient yourself further and prove that you're on the right track.
fields.title: Hunt for Ancient Signs of Passage

fields.description: Some of them may have been working from better maps than you, and of those, some may have come close to the treasure.
fields.title: Look for Signs of Earlier Hunters

fields.description: Previous treasure hunters have probably been this way before. If you're unlucky, they've already dug up the treasure. If you're lucky, they got close before giving up.
fields.title: Look for Evidence of Digging

fields.description: With some luck and a lot of careful observation, you may be able to find where the cache was originally concealed.
fields.title: Start Digging

fields.description: You can use the directions the agents previously gave you to see him.
fields.title: Pay the Patriarch a Visit

fields.description: If Poria's entire network focuses on the task, she may be able to discover where he's hiding.
fields.title: Try to Locate the Hideout

fields.description: He asked you to come by, and one does not keep the Patriarch waiting.
fields.title: Visit the Great House

fields.description: He claims to have one of the best historical collections in Lok, including a few pre-Kingdom tomes.
fields.title: Read through the Histories

fields.description: The Kingdom is generally known to be more hospitable to etherists than any of the Houses, so books from there may speak more directly on the subject.
fields.title: Look for a Book from the Kingdom

fields.description: Skal has long been fascinated with mythical heroes, so there's always something new to read.
fields.title: Study Myths

fields.description: This book appears to collect summaries of various teachings from within the Lyceum.
fields.title: Read a Lyceum Catalog

fields.description: You can narrow in on Kingdom histories to try and get a better picture of the role etherists play.
fields.title: Focus your Research

fields.description: It seems likely that modern etherists have at least some inkling of the First Etherist. One of them may let something slip in their writings.
fields.title: Read Contemporary Etherists

fields.description: You have a title but no author or cover to go by. It may take a little legwork.
fields.title: Find the Book

fields.description: Defend yourself.
fields.title: Fight

fields.description: Fight off the thief.
fields.title: Defend yourself

fields.description: Defend against the attacking bear.
fields.title: Fight

fields.description: It's a fine excuse to visit a new place.
fields.title: Accept the Mission

fields.description: It's good to see that she's doing well. She'll surely be pleased to hear from her lover.
fields.title: Hand Her the Letter

fields.description: These will likely please the next person you meet.
fields.title: Buy a Bouquet

fields.description: She looks like she's running a tidy operation here. Perhaps you can expand it with her.
fields.title: Offer to Help Her Sell

fields.description: You have an opportunity to compare and contrast a wide assortment of flora. Best not to waste it.
fields.title: Examine the Flowers

fields.description: While not an exciting subject, it's safe to assume that an elder will have the kind of disposable income for this sort of thing.
fields.title: Suggest Drawing an Elder's Portrait

fields.description: Being interested in sword fighting, you would appreciate a proper sketch of a fighter's stance.
fields.title: Suggest Drawing a Duelist's Anatomy

fields.description: What better way to make your name known than ordering a flattering picture of yourself?
fields.title: Commission a Portrait of Yourself

fields.description: This will get the blood flowing and spirits rising.
fields.title: Request a Rousing Battle Song

fields.description: These songs always have the nicest, most flowery expressions.
fields.title: Request an Epic Love Ballad

fields.description: Surely there must be a song or two about those who kept to the shadows.
fields.title: Request a Tale of Subtlety

fields.description: You'll need good aim to knock them over and win a prize.
fields.title: Hit the Pins

fields.description: If you have enough strength, you can try to lift the giant hammer and sound the gong.
fields.title: Ring the Bell

fields.description: Several other people are here as well, wandering around. This presents an opportunity!
fields.title: Pick Some Pockets

fields.description: You get the feeling it would be unwise to be found holding these things. You'll need to slip them under peoples' doors while nobody is watching.
fields.title: Assist the Man

fields.description: Whatever he wants, it doesn't seem to include the well-being of the local powers. They may reward an upright citizen who reports his activities.
fields.title: Turn Him In

fields.description: He seems to be bothering people here. They may appreciate it if you can make him stop without causing a disturbance.
fields.title: Convince Him to Stop

fields.description: With a strong back, you can help with the landscaping gruntwork, and get some exercise as well.
fields.title: Work the Yard

fields.description: Does he already have a foreman or forewoman? If not, you could round up some workers and oversee the job.
fields.title: Assemble a Crew

fields.description: While not a working farm, the estate does boast several elaborate flower gardens, which have been sadly ravaged by rabbits. You can try tracking down their den.
fields.title: Deal with Critters

fields.description: You have a one-in-six chance to win the pot.
fields.title: Place a Bet

fields.description: Someone with quick fingers and a talent for distraction can make the dice favor them. You'll need some skill to make sure you don't get caught, though.
fields.title: Influence the Odds

fields.description: The cartel may have some ideas on opportunities for profit.
fields.title: Speak with the Cartel

fields.description: Something like this will probably sell well in a smaller town, farther away from major trade routes.
fields.title: Buy the Carvings

fields.description: A true enthusiast will pay handsomely for such an artifact.
fields.title: Find Buyers for Carvings

fields.description: There's a lot of wheat there. The farmer may give you a break.
fields.title: Negotiate a Price

fields.description: You should be able to find buyers who will accept a future delivery of wheat. The question is, how well will they pay?
fields.title: Unload Wheat Scrip

fields.description: The best ferry operators don't just cross the Tanalga, but also provide guidance on the other side.
fields.title: Find a Boat

fields.description: You would only ever need one, of course, but you may be able to sell the remainder off.
fields.title: Purchase Swords

fields.description: The weight and shape will be fine for their training, and the quartermaster will be pleased to avoid the cost of higher-quality swords.
fields.title: Sell some Copper Swords

fields.description: The cartel tends to operate informally, but it will help to get several witnesses.
fields.title: Gather a Quorum of Merchants

fields.description: These expensive goods are made to order, and could sell well in more rural areas.
fields.title: Order A Tapestry

fields.description: See if you can find someone interested in a fine hanging for their wall.
fields.title: Find a Buyer

fields.description: Many people travel these roads. Someone must have seen this sign.
fields.title: Make Inquiries

fields.description: A sign which is that old should have left some record behind.
fields.title: Conduct Research

fields.description: Bards usually advertise their presence loudly and widely. One of your associates may have heard something.
fields.title: Listen for News

fields.description: If this bard has been practicing for ten years, someone may have already written down his tale. There's no sense in needlessly chasing him.
fields.title: Search Through Records

fields.description: Bards move around frequently, but you may be able to pick up his trail.
fields.title: Track the Bard

fields.description: Appeal to his better nature.
fields.title: Persuade the Bard to Stop

fields.description: One can find assassins to do such work, if one is willing to pay the coin.
fields.title: Order the Bard's Execution

fields.description: No need to kill him. A show of force and a clear warning should send the right message.
fields.title: Intimidate the Bard

fields.description: He's the worst of the worst: a thief not only of treasure, but of another man's virtue. The world will be well rid of him.
fields.title: Personally Kill the Bard

fields.description: The adventurer is settling down and has little use for his trusty mare.
fields.title: A Horse

fields.description: The adventurer has saved enough for a comfortable retirement, and would gladly pay for the help you've given.
fields.title: Royals

fields.description: Without anyone trying to kill him, the adventurer no longer needs his battered breastplate. It could do you some good. Armor will not help much against lower-level enemies, but becomes more useful as enemies become stronger.
fields.title: Armor

fields.description: She seems to avoid company, but some persuasive words could convince her to open up to you.
fields.title: Chat with the Woman

fields.description: When she's out and about, you can make a thorough investigation of her cottage.
fields.title: Spy on the Woman

fields.description: Where did she live before she came to Tummon? There must be some records of her from before her mysterious arrival.
fields.title: Research the Woman

fields.description: The townsfolk of Tummon will need very little encouragement to expel an etherist.
fields.title: Run Her Out of Town

fields.description: She doesn't seem to be bothering anyone. Well, other than the matron. Let's see where this goes.
fields.title: Keep Her Secret

fields.description: Etherists are feared, which is a kind of celebrity of its own. Spreading around word may help ensure her safety if not her privacy.
fields.title: Expose Her

fields.description: She's in no position to pay, but would appreciate your help while she gets settled.
fields.title: Donate Supplies

fields.description: You're having second thoughts about harboring an etherist in secret. Time to have a meeting with the local mob.
fields.title: Run Her Out

fields.description: She's actually quite a pleasant woman once she lets her guard down. Let her know that she has nothing to fear from this town.
fields.title: Encourage Her to Go Public

fields.description: This may help your body recover from your weakness... or send you back to bed with even more pain.
fields.title: Try to Exercise

fields.description: Let them know it's in their interest to see you're taken care of.
fields.title: Request Personal Attention

fields.description: It isn't a bribe, exactly. More an appreciation rendered in advance of services received.
fields.title: Hire a Trainer

fields.description: You'll need to queue for most of the day, but the poultices you'll receive should help your recovery.
fields.title: Apply for Treatment

fields.description: This sounds intriguing...
fields.title: Follow

fields.description: Dall has his own loyalists in his wing. You'll need to be stealthy to avoid their attention.
fields.title: Sneak Through the Great House

fields.description: It'll be tricky to reach Dall's innermost rooms, but that's where you're most likely to find garments with Dall's emblem.
fields.title: Enter Dall's Bedchamber

fields.description: A safer option. The commonfolk will keep their distance, and few are likely to challenge you.
fields.title: Promenade in Gamanar

fields.description: A riskier option. Dall's face is known here. But, if you can pass unnoticed in his home, you will likely be prepared for any impersonation.
fields.title: Stroll Through the Great House

fields.description: Listen to counsel that was intended for Dall's ears only.
fields.title: Speak with Dall's Advisors

fields.description: Dall's actions are highly inappropriate, but nobody will be able to complain if he accomplishes his coup. Early exposure could create enough outrage to stop him.
fields.title: Inform Pell

fields.description: Enough of this charade. If you inform Dall of his brother's manipulations - anonymously, of course - Pell will lose face, clearing the way for Dall's arrival.
fields.title: Inform Dall

fields.description: This may be a lucrative, or at the very least an interesting, opportunity.
fields.title: Visit the Cartel

fields.description: Fight
fields.title: Fight

fields.description: Fight
fields.title: Fight

fields.description: Fight
fields.title: Fight

fields.description: You've shown your talent at finding things that others cannot locate. Those services could be valuable.
fields.title: Offer Your Services

fields.description: See what evidence you can find of Gell or his captor.
fields.title: Examine the Camp

fields.description: He must have passed through this way, willingly or otherwise.
fields.title: Check the Outskirts

fields.description: See if you can pick up his trail.
fields.title: Hunt through the Forests

fields.description: If you're fortunate, you might be able to find him.
fields.title: Check Inside

fields.description: Try and catch up to them before they disappear from sight!
fields.title: Give Chase

fields.description: Has the kidnapper moved on alone?
fields.title: Follow the Large Prints

fields.description: Is the captive Gell awaiting rescue?
fields.title: Follow the Small Prints

fields.description: Dall is always surrounded by his soldiers, but you have earned their respect.
fields.title: Request an Audience

fields.description: Your silver tongue can open many doors. Perhaps it can open doors for Pell, too.
fields.title: Seek an Audience with Pell

fields.description: Hansa does a brisk trade along the Tanalga river. You can find fields nearby with farmers willing to sell their crops.
fields.title: Make a Purchase

fields.description: Local grocers will happily pay for future deliveries of sugar, which they can stockpile for months.
fields.title: Sell to Stores

fields.description: The bureaucrats have no direct say in the succession, but any new Patriarch will need their cooperation to rule effectively.
fields.title: Extoll Pell's Virtues

fields.description: At any given time, several members of the diplomatic corps are home on assignment. Speak with some of them to line up their support.
fields.title: Promote Pell

fields.description: It's time to go on the offensive. Explain to the revenuers why Dall would be a poor choice for the Gol patriarchy.
fields.title: Discredit Dall

fields.description: Lining up a distant cousin or two will only help Pell's chances.
fields.title: Talk with Relatives

fields.description: Argue that Dall is clearly unfit for the Patriarchy and enlist their support.
fields.title: Visit the Diplomats Again

fields.description: Your employer certainly expects you to push him over the top, and is prepared to reward you handsomely for doing so.
fields.title: Argue for Pell

fields.description: Pell won't be pleased, but you can reaffirm Dall's position as the default heir to Gol.
fields.title: Make a Case for Dall

fields.description: You have made more trips between Tandan and Naper in recent weeks than most merchants have made in their entire lives. You're in a good position to talk down the appeal of commerce with Naper.
fields.title: Subtly Insult Naper

fields.description: As a repeat customer, you may get a better deal.
fields.title: Purchase Wheat

fields.description: A location close to the Tanalga river will be ideal for delivery.
fields.title: Locate a Mill

fields.description: They're eager to hear about the progress of your campaign to alter the trading habits of Tandan, Naper, and Hansa.
fields.title: Report to the Cartel

fields.description: The House is converting the former mint building into a makeshift museum to display the artifacts. Get the lay of the land.
fields.title: Investigate

fields.description: See if it offers potential ingress.
fields.title: Examine an Opening

fields.description: If a thief does happen to make it all the way inside, a well-crafted lock will significantly slow down their progress.
fields.title: Pick the Locks

fields.description: You'll need extreme care and silence to avoid jangling the metallic keys or pressing too firmly against the guard's flesh.
fields.title: Silently Snatch Some Keys

fields.description: Some of the hallways in the mint will be blocked off during the exhibition, and will offer tempting passage to an intruder. You could rig one to impede their progress.
fields.title: Booby-Trap a Corridor

fields.description: There isn't enough room in the case for springing spikes or anything elaborate like that; but you could try and build a system that will eject the treasure into a second container!
fields.title: Trap the Case

fields.description: If a thief wants to make a really big splash, they'll make their move while the most attention is being paid.
fields.title: Stand Watch on Opening Night

fields.description: You've earned House Gol's trust with your assistance, and are better-positioned than anyone else in the land to steal a few gems.
fields.title: Help Yourself

fields.description: That cottage on the edge of town is looking quite nice these days. And, from what you've heard lately, its occupant is running quite a nice little school these days.
fields.title: Visit the Etherist

fields.description: Presumably this is some sort of test. Presumably ether is involved.
fields.title: Attempt to Deflect the Apple Barrage

fields.description: That seems to be what Yanofol is asking you to do.
fields.title: Push the Fence with Ether

fields.description: No need to actually harm it, of course. Seeing a rock move by itself should prove sufficiently startling for the feline.
fields.title: Roll a Rock Toward the Cat

fields.description: Every morning Yanofol follows the same routine: eating a bowl of turnips and yelling at the ceiling. It might be amusing to knock over his prized turnip bucket. At the least, it would give him something new to yell about.
fields.title: Pull a Prank

fields.description: Yanofol has been very explicit: only pushing will be allowed, no pulling. This will require some careful nuance to place things properly and not knock them over the edge.
fields.title: Prepare the Table

fields.description: You and Yanofol. On a large rock in the middle of a stream. Pushing one another through the ether. The first one to get wet, loses.
fields.title: Accept the Challenge

fields.description: Her quiet cottage at the edge of town is filled with books. She may be able to advise the best way to continue your studies.
fields.title: Speak with the Etherist

fields.description: On a calm day, you can try to start a breeze; on a blustery day, you can feel for the presence of ether.
fields.title: Conduct Experiments

fields.description: You can see whether your powers work under water, and draw conclusions about what that means about the nature of ether.
fields.title: Project Into Water

fields.description: Find some wild creatures, start some ether flows, and see what happens.
fields.title: Gently Experiment

fields.description: Experiment to see whether ether can enter all items equally.
fields.title: Try to Penetrate Items

fields.description: You can try to glean useful information while avoiding getting soaked.
fields.title: Observe a Lightning Storm

fields.description: Not a big one, of course. But if you are right about the way ether underlies the transmission of energy, this will be a fairly compelling proof.
fields.title: Cause an Earthquake

fields.description: Attack
fields.title: Fight

fields.description: Fight
fields.title: Fight

fields.description: Fight
fields.title: Fight

fields.description: Fight
fields.title: Fight

fields.description: Fight
fields.title: Fight

fields.description: Fight
fields.title: Fight

fields.description: Fight
fields.title: Fight

fields.description: Fight
fields.title: Fight

fields.description: Fight
fields.title: Fight

fields.description: Fight
fields.title: Fight

fields.description: Fight
fields.title: Fight

fields.name: Unearthed the Secrets of Nature
fields.description: You proved the role of ether in facilitating natural phenomena like wind, waves, lightning, and earthquakes.

fields.name: Ether and Nature
fields.description: Examine the relationship between the ether and natural phenomena.

fields.name: Survived an Apprenticeship
fields.description: You endured a confusing and occasionally painful apprenticeship under the insane etherist Yanofol, emerging with a firm understanding of how to push through ether.

fields.name: Apprenticed to a Madman
fields.description: You are learning further secrets of the ether from an insane etherist in rural Tandan.

fields.name: Pulled Off a Heist
fields.description: You stole priceless artifacts from under House Gol's nose, without them even noticing.

fields.name: Safeguarded House Gol's Artifacts
fields.description: You oversaw security in the museum for House Gol's successful exhibition of priceless artifacts.

fields.name: House Gol's Jewels
fields.description: Oversee the preparations House Gol is making for the security of an upcoming exhibition of precious artifacts.

fields.name: Campaigning for Pell
fields.description: Convince government officials in Gamanar to support Pell's attempt to become the heir to House Gol.

fields.name: Rescued Gell of House Gol
fields.description: You rescued Gell of House Gol, the son of Dall and a potential future Patriarch.

fields.name: Locating a Lost Child
fields.description: You are investigating the possible kidnapping of Gell, the son of Dall of House Gol.

fields.name: Trade Manipulation
fields.description: You will be encouraging trade between Naper and Hansa in an effort to improve Tandan's economic ties with the Kingdom.

fields.name: Dismantled Spying
fields.description: You built, and ultimately dismantled, a spying operation in Gamanar. Dall of House Gol has learned of his brother Pell's duplicity.

fields.name: Averted a Coup
fields.description: You successfully impersonated Dall of House Gol, gaining crucial information and thwarting an attempted coup.

fields.name: Impersonating Dall
fields.description: You are participating in a scheme by Pell of House Gol to impersonate his estranged brother Dall.

fields.name: Exposed the Etherist
fields.description: You announced the etherist's abilities to the village of Tummon, transforming her into a minor local celebrity.

fields.name: Expelled the Etherist
fields.description: You drove an etherist from the village of Tummon, clearing space for a more respectable etherist to enter.

fields.name: Settling Etherist
fields.description: An etherist in Tummon wants to settle down and study.

fields.name: Killed the Bard
fields.description: You secured a retiring adventurer's legacy by killing a bard who had betrayed his vow.

fields.name: Spared the Bard's Life
fields.description: You secured a retiring adventurer's legacy by convincing a slandering bard to honor his vow.

fields.name: Acquired a Horse
fields.description: You acquired a horse.

fields.name: Member of the Risapo Cartel
fields.description: You have joined the association of merchants who dominate trade through Tandan's port city of Risapo.

fields.name: Joining the Risapo Cartel
fields.description: Buy and sell special goods in Risapo and other areas to demonstrate your value to the cartel.

fields.name: Learned the Secret of the First Etherist
fields.description: You discovered the little-known link between the First Etherist and the Kingdom.

fields.name: Finding the First Etherist
fields.description: To the library! You are attempting to discern the origins of a historical figure known as "The First Etherist."

fields.name: Savior of Patriarch Ettan
fields.description: You rescued Patriarch Ettan from numerous assassination attempts and earned the title Agent.

fields.name: Found Buried Treasure
fields.description: You deciphered an ancient treasure map and located the near-legendary cache of House Forcan.

fields.name: Opened a New Trade Route
fields.description: You convinced Patriarch Tandan to allow vessels from the Kingdom to dock at the port in Risapo, greatly pleasing the merchants and craftsmen in that city.

fields.name: Lobbying for Free Trade
fields.description: You have been hired to convince Tandan citizens, and ultimately the Patriarch, to allow direct trade with the Kingdom.

fields.name: Framed Gellar
fields.description: You discredited Patriarch Tandan's son and heir, removing him from the line of succession and averting - or at least delaying - a war with the Kingdom.

fields.name: Betrayed Yalene to Gellar
fields.description: You revealed the schemes of a presumed agent of the Kingdom to Patriarch Tandan's heir.

fields.name: Infiltrate Great House Tandan
fields.description: A secretive woman has recruited you to do her business in the Great House in Risapo.

fields.name: Treasure Hunting
fields.description: An old map in your possession claims to point the way to House Forcan's lost fortune.

fields.name: Mapped Mad Sigar's Mansion
fields.description: You skillfully manipulated ether while aiding the Group for the Exploration of Manse Sigar, ultimately uncovering a cache of historical documents.

fields.name: An Agent of Hansa
fields.description: Patriarch Hansa has recognized your service in combating the menaces facing his House.

fields.name: Thwarted Sabotage
fields.description: You disrupted the activities of a mysterious trio of agents who had been wreaking havoc in the lands west of Tanalga River.

fields.name: Mapping the Ethereal Mansion
fields.description: A historical preservation society needs someone of your talents to help explore Mad Sigar's ether-obsessive mansion.

fields.name: Betrayed Green Haron
fields.description: You helped Green Haron rob Mad Sigar's mansion, and ultimately turned him over to the authorities for justice.

fields.name: Turned Tables on Green Haron
fields.description: You helped Green Haron rob Mad Sigar's mansion, and ultimately tricked him into a trap, claiming the mansion's bounty for yourself.

fields.name: Aided Green Haron
fields.description: You helped the leader of Ettan's most notorious gang of thieves complete his audacious burglary of Mad Sigar's mansion.

fields.name: Robbing the Mansion
fields.description: Green Haron's gang of thieves is liberating many valuables from Mad Sigar's mansion.

fields.name: Sabotage
fields.description: Your quest to uncover the culprits behind a suspicious blaze leads in unexpected directions.

fields.name: Child of None
fields.description: You grew up as an orphan, initially surviving on the kindness of strangers, and eventually learning to make your own way in life without the support of parents.

fields.name: Child of Teachers
fields.description: You grew up in one of the few schools in Skal, and gained an appreciation of knowledge for its own sake.

fields.name: Child of Warriors
fields.description: Your mother and your father were both fighters and adventurers, who not only survived long enough to bear a child but passed all of their knowledge on to you.

fields.name: Child of Minor Nobility
fields.description: You are the latest heir to an obscure branch of House Engoth.

fields.name: Child of Farmers
fields.description: You grew up on the land, tilling the soil with your own hands and protecting your crops and flocks from wild animals.

fields.name: Child of Traders
fields.description: You came of age in a fairly well-to-do household of cloth traders.

fields.name: Learning the Ways of the World
fields.description: You are getting older, wiser, and stronger every day.

fields.name: Battling Brigands
fields.description: You are helping the army control the presence and movement of brigands in the area.

fields.name: Apprentice Archer
fields.description: A huntress is teaching you the way of the bow.

fields.name: Brawling with the Bairds
fields.description: The town is growing increasingly alarmed by your frequent altercations with the pugilistic Baird brothers.

fields.name: A Practical Introduction to Ether
fields.description: You are beginning to explore the mysteries of your body's connection with ether.

fields.name: Built a Bridge
fields.description: You built a bridge! Well, you gathered supplies and labor for the building of a bridge, which is practically the same thing.

fields.name: Bridge Building
fields.description: You are gathering materials to sell for House Engoth's new bridge.

fields.name: Captured the Poacher Ringleader
fields.description: You mastered the use of traps and came up with an ingenious way to catch the poacher who was plaguing the Patriarch's forest.

fields.name: Trapping
fields.description: You are assisting a gamekeeper in managing traps in the woods.

fields.name: Spied Temor's Mistress's Connections
fields.description: You witnessed a suspicious exchange taking place between Temor's secret lover and a foreigner who may have come from the Republic.

fields.name: Tracking Spies for House Naper
fields.description: Assisting Temor in his efforts to locate local spies.

fields.name: Made Sam the Elder
fields.description: You aided Sam, a prosperous drygoodsman, in his claim to become the new elder of a village.

fields.name: Made Peter the Elder
fields.description: You have campaigned on behalf of Peter, the former blacksmith and new elder of a village. He owes you for his seat.

fields.name: Supporting Sam Yole
fields.description: You have decided to support the local drygoodsman in his attempt to become the new village elder.

fields.name: Supporting Peter Burst
fields.description: You have cast in your lot with the village blacksmith in his bid for the elder's chair.

fields.name: Choosing an Elder
fields.description: Assisting a village in selecting its new leader.

fields.name: Acquiring Animals
fields.description: Local butchers have recruited you to hunt some animals.

fields.name: Family Legacy
fields.description: You agreed to help a retired adventurer secure objects for his children's future.
Encourage locals to support your candidate in his quest to become the new village Elder.
Hunt animals to supply meat for the village's butchers.
Observe and participate in fights against the brigands.
Collect materials and labor for construction of House Engoth's new bridge.
Meet Trindan in the village tavern and learn what he knows.
Wait for Trindan to finish his investigations. Look for him in the village tavern.
Investigate the three suspected saboteurs and collect evidence about their activities.
Follow Trindan's leads to identify the people who gave orders to the saboteurs.
Travel to the cabin in the countryside and confront the saboteurs' masters.
Find Trindan's cave in the Engoth countryside.
Travel to the house in Tummon that Trindan had marked before his death.
Assist Green Haron and his thieves as they move deeper into Mad Sigar's mansion.
A historical preservation society needs someone of your talents to help explore Mad Sigar's ether-obsessive mansion.
Visit Trindan's widow in Ettan.
Poria needs help convincing her late husband's agents to report to her.
Visit the Great House in Ettan to warn the Patriarch of some arriving assassins.
Wait to learn the whereabouts of Patriarch Hansa.
Foil any additional attempts to assassinate Patriarch Hansa.
Search for signs of treasure based off the drawings on your treasure map.
A secretive woman has recruited you to do her business in the Great House in Risapo.
You have been hired to convince Tandan citizens, and ultimately the Patriarch, to allow direct trade with the Kingdom.
Wait for word from Patriarch Ettan.
See the Patriarch at his capital in Ettan.
To the library! You are attempting to discern the origins of a historical figure known as "The First Etherist."
Buy and sell special goods in Risapo and other areas to demonstrate your value to the cartel.
Shadow the suspects Temor has identified, trying to discover which one intercepted his secret message.
Assist a gamekeeper with detecting and disposing of poachers' traps in the woods.
Experiment with ether to determine your capabilities.
Decide how to handle the newly-arrived etherist.
Help the etherist collect supplies for her program. Or not.
You are participating in a scheme by Pell of House Gol to impersonate his estranged brother Dall.
Trade in Naper and Hansa to drive a wedge between them and Tandan.
You are investigating the possible kidnapping of Gell, the son of Dall of House Gol.
Visit Dall in the House Gol countryside to discuss your rescue of his son Gell.
Convince government officials in Gamanar to support Pell's attempt to become the heir to House Gol.
Oversee the preparations House Gol is making in Gamanar for the security of an upcoming exhibition of precious artifacts.
You are learning further secrets of the ether from an insane etherist in rural Tandan.
Examine the relationship between the ether and natural phenomena.

The beasts quietly move along. You may be imagining things, but you feel like they appreciate your mercy. You also notice how their careful steps avoid crunching any twigs underfoot; following their example may help you if you ever become the hunted.
fields.title: Graceful and Grateful

fields.description: On second thought, these are much too large to carry with you. Still, this tale will impress many who hear you tell it.
fields.title: Antlers to Admire

fields.description: The animal leads you on a merry chase, and you pick up a new trick or two during the pursuit. That evening, the meat tastes all the sweeter for the effort you spent.
fields.title: Virtuous Venison

fields.description: Ouch, that was unpleasant to see. The mob is busy enough that they fail to notice when their blows knock loose a few coins. You nonchalantly pick up a few that roll your way.
fields.title: Blood and Coins

fields.description: The first few men don't see what hit them, and the remainder are startled enough to quickly give up the fight. The grateful boy bounds off, but not before giving you a word of appreciation and the incriminating evidence.
fields.title: The Fist is Mightier than the Pen

fields.description: It's amazing how quickly a single shout of "Fire!" will disperse a crowd. The boy runs off before you can speak to him. Hopefully he will stay out of trouble in the future.
fields.title: Aversion

fields.description: The lock easily yields to your prodding. Most of the contents are worthless, but you glean a few shining coins from the bottom.
fields.title: A Fistful of Royals

fields.description: You later learn that few other people noticed the star. Telling the tale impresses them, a little.
fields.title: Whispers on the Wind

fields.description: You certainly didn't expect your wish to be granted so quickly! Your eye catches a glimmer on the ground; groping into the dark, your fingers close around the satisfying weight of a small coin.
fields.title: Ask and You Shall Receive

fields.description: Why do stars fall? Are they really stars at all? A shooting star is a rare sight, but they happen often enough that you would expect the sky to be empty by now. If you were watching a star at the right time, could you trace its fall from the beginning? You pass several quiet minutes studying a portion of sky to memorize the positions of its lights.
fields.title: Few Answers, Many Questions

fields.description: You sit on the ground and let the peace of the evening wash over you. Who knows what tomorrow will bring? In this moment, you feel that all is right in the world.
fields.title: Contentment

fields.description: "Have you ever unaccountably felt a shiver while walking through a certain area? Such feelings occur in places where the ether is especially thin. Outside its customary embrace, you are briefly disconnected from its continuity with the rest of the world. The next time you shiver and do not feel cold, wait there for a moment. Feel what is around you. Try to detect the ether nearby. If you can, try to pull it towards yourself and help fill the void..."
fields.title: Grains of Knowledge

fields.description: "Well, no, we can't directly observe ether, but we can deduce its existence. Consider the wind: it has enough force to bend a tree! Yet no person has actually seen wind itself. Ether is yet another substance that we can manipulate with our bodies, which in turn can manipulate other objects. You raise a hand to toss a rock at a bottle. You purse your lips to blow your breath into a flower. And ether? Sadly, those... muscles, you might call them, are rarely used, but with enough practice you can make them push out, and create your own waves in the ether..."
fields.title: Unified Theory of Ether

fields.description: While the competition is in good fun, both of you clearly wish to win. You face one another, each standing still, except for flinching when a blow from ether lands on a body. You realize that he is focusing his attacks on your legs, and you shift your attentions to forming a barrier in front of them. Once he exhausts himself with his useless strikes, you counter-attack, sending one knock after another into his chest. He finally concedes the match, and shakes your hand when he hands over the coins.
fields.title: Knockabout

fields.description: Just as you suspected: a rat has been trailing you. From the looks of things, it has grown fat on your largess. The extra size makes it easier to snatch on its next outing. A victory!
fields.title: Caught in the Act!

fields.description: "Ay, that was the war I thought would make me a man. Little did I realize it would turn me into an old one! No, I will not tell the tale of how my fingers abandoned my hand, not until I've had more cups in me. I'll tell you instead about General Yorden, how he won his battle and lost his House's war. You see, Yorden was a maceman, and knew better than any how to drive a powerful blow against a weak spot. When he led his audacious crossing over the river and into House Gol territory, nothing could stand in his path. Once he started winning, he couldn't turn back. He ended up deep in Gol land, far in front of his supply lines, and out of touch from the real action back at the river. They say that when Naper sued for peace, he wept all the way home. Let that be a lesson for all: swing hard enough to hit, but not so hard that you can't pull back."
fields.title: A Valorous Tale

fields.description: "There was a Patriarch named Sibold Whose daughter's ambitions were quite bold She raised up an army And marched them to the sea Then back home before her lunch grew cold"
fields.title: A Memorable Verse

fields.description: If there's one thing you've learned about the wealthy, it's that they despise competition. Try as you might to eavesdrop, they fall silent whenever you wander within range of their discussion.
fields.title: Frozen Out

fields.description: What luck! It turns out that the middle-aged woman in blue is freshly arrived from the country, and has asked her companions for advice on selling her goods locally. You glean some useful and timely information about the excess supply of wheat flooding the markets, and what goods can earn more coin.
fields.title: Current Market Prices

fields.description: Picking pockets has rarely felt so easy! You gather more than you had expected, and in a fit of generosity, you order a round for the whole tavern. Everyone, including those you have just robbed, cheers you loudly. Best of all, after this display nobody will have the nerve to accuse you of theft!
fields.title: Ten for You, and Ten for the House

fields.description: The father is overjoyed to see his children home again. "I wish they would stop wandering off like that!" he exclaims. "One of these days, they'll learn their lesson. In the meantime, thanks be that we have good souls like you in the world."
fields.title: Safe, Sound, and Found

fields.description: The children are happy to sleep in their beds again. Their father is happy to have them back. You are happy with the new coins in your pocket. Everyone got what they wanted. One could almost wish there were more missing children in the world...
fields.title: Smiles All Around

fields.description: You face the stream's center and dive. The force of the current immediately starts pulling you downstream. Fighting back and down, you plunge towards where you saw the coins. Your grasping hands pull up sand, which flies around and obscures your vision. Reaching out blindly, you cut your palm on an unusually sharp rock, and lose precious breath in an inadvertent yelp of pain. Your other hand fares better, and scoops up most of the coins before you resurface. You drag yourself to the shore, coughing and bleeding, but pleased nonetheless at your bounty.
fields.title: Sputtering Riches

fields.description: Amazing! While you catch your breath, you look around and drink in the landscape. Lush forests give way to rich fields, and smoke rises from a small hamlet in the distance. A hawk soars below you. People on the road look as small as ants; you wave at them with great gusto.
fields.title: A Stunning View

fields.description: There's so much to learn up here in the sky that you entirely lose track of your goal. You never see those grubs in the lowlands. Several hawks fly below you, giving a rare chance to see the shape of their wings from above. And that blue flower... what's it called, Selese's Tear? It always looks sickly on the plains, but it seems to thrive up here, growing happily in the shade of giant oak trees.
fields.title: Nature's Puzzles

fields.description: Taking down a bird on the wing seems challenging, but it's easier when you aim at a solid group of them. The murmuration of starlings hears the loud squawking of the fallen and beats a hasty retreat. You collect your coins from the impressed farmer, and help yourself to the birds as well.
fields.title: Well Shot!

fields.description: ... or perhaps they find you too amusing? The starlings seem mesmerized by your antics, and coalesce from across the sky into a roiling mass over your head. Fortunately, this gives the farmer a perfect opportunity to start tossing small stones at them, and they eventually disperse. You hadn't realized that you were this captivating to living creatures. The farmer grumbles but hands over a few coins for your efforts.
fields.title: A Scary Sight

fields.description:
Working carefully, with your eyes closed, you gently push outward at the ether around you. You move it slowly enough to form a semi-solid threshold. When the next bird dives down to snatch a berry, it makes a pleasing "bonk" sound and bounces off your barrier. It angrily attempts again, as do its fellows, but they eventually realize the hopelessness of their task and fly off.

The farmer seems awestruck at your action, and terrified by your presence. He pays you more than you expect and then graciously shoos you off his land.
fields.title: Avian Confusion

fields.description: It's hard to believe anyone takes this seriously. The author claims that ether is created by superior beings who live in the sky, that one must recite special words in order to tap its powers, that mastering ether allows one to create new animals and predict the future. You don't consider yourself an expert of ether, and even you know this is all false. In fact, you come to the conclusion that several other arguments made by the author are false, and glumly toss the book in the gutter after satisfying your curiosity.
fields.title: Absurdity

fields.description:
The diagrams within the book are quite useful, albeit rather familiar. They pay particular attention to the basics: the proper grasp, the shapes of various blades, how much to bend one's knees. You don't precisely learn anything new, but it's always helpful to be reminded of fundamentals, especially when they can save your life.

A young adventuring lass spies you with the book, and offers to buy it off you. You manage to recoup much of your initial investment.
fields.title: Dusty Wisdom

fields.description: At first, you are excited by the secrets the book reveals. It looks like the author painstakingly took apart dozens of locks, carefully illustrating their component parts. Knowing in advance what one might encounter helps one avoid fumbling around in the dark. Your enthusiasm fades somewhat when you read the author's obsequious fawning over King Seffon; the monarch has been dead for nearly a century, so the vulnerabilities exposed by this tome have probably been corrected in all but the oldest locks you will encounter. You resolve to use the book for kindling the next time you make a campfire.
fields.title: Crevices

fields.description:
You deduce that the fox sign must have been erected by Pater Velkin, whose family has used that sigil for generations. It takes a few days of wandering the roads, and you need to chase off a few bandits yourself, but eventually you find it. 

The sign is smaller than the adventurer described, but he enthusiastically accepts it. "I can't wait for the day I can show this to my boy, and tell him about the first heroic deed done by his father! Come back tomorrow, and I'll have another job for you."
fields.title: Snatched Sign

fields.description: The first few men don't see what hit them, but their friends are quick to pounce on you. Their anger already runs high, and you quickly decide to beat a retreat. Fortunately, the young boy has made a similar escape already.
fields.title: Branches and Rocks

fields.description: You thrash the ringleaders so thoroughly that the gang immediately disperses, howling in pain and loudly promising to leave the child alone from now on. You set off in pursuit, and they fling down copper royals in a successful effort to slow your pursuit. You split the bounty with the grateful lad. "We Mice mostly look out for ourselves, but we're grateful for those who give us aid. Perhaps one of us can return the favor to you some day."
fields.title: A Mighty Blow

fields.description: "I'm glad you came in! You look like a capable sort. For years Tomas Raffling has brought in animals for me, but he's getting older and doesn't like to wander. Could you head out into the countryside with him and help track down some game? He'll help you bag it, and the two of you can split my payment. Here's a little something to get you started. Happy hunting!"
fields.title: Go Forth and Gather

fields.description: A dozen unbranded beasts contentedly munch on the wild grass. You carefully note their location, then travel back with Tomas to bring them in. Many people will eat well tonight.
fields.title: Yes, Those Are Cows

fields.description: You can't believe it. There must be hundreds of those large, lumbering beasts. Why can't you spot a single one? You resolve to return later, and maybe drag Tomas along to give you some pointers.
fields.title: Ghosts of the Grassland

fields.description: ... nineteen, twenty, twenty-one! That should provide plenty of chops and racks for the coming week. You and Tomas drive the herd into town and split the reward.
fields.title: Counted Sheep

fields.description: You thought you'd spotted the errant flock, but it proved to be a distant group of white boulders. You return home empty-handed, vowing to track down the beasts in your next outing.
fields.title: Surprisingly Elusive

fields.description: The largest beasts leave tell-tale broken branches in their wake. You trace these back to the source, where you find many succulent specimens. Driving them into town proves challenging, but fortunately Tomas's expert pig-wrangling skills are up to the task.
fields.title: Bringing Bacon

fields.description: You attempt to track the pigs by their spoor, but it only nauseates you.
fields.title: Stinky Failure

fields.description: Capturing enough rabbits for a single meal takes almost a full day. You learn that you can't hope to chase the rabbits once you spot them; instead, you need to predict where they will come, and then patiently wait for them to arrive. You manage to fill a squirming sack before nightfall and bring it back to the butcher. Since you didn't need Tomas's assistance, you receive the full payment for yourself.
fields.title: In the Bag

fields.description: You spend the entire day chasing after the swift critters. They're crafty, though, and have dug plenty of holes to escape predators like you. When the sun descends below the horizon, you're forced to admit defeat.
fields.title: Where's They Go?

fields.description: You can't find any conclusive proof that such a creature exists, but there are definitely prints like those of a large cat in the mud. Those markings on the side of a rock could well have been from a tusk that rubbed against it. And there are definitely fewer nesting birds in this area than there were just a short time ago...
fields.title: Faint but Compelling

fields.description: You interview a man who claims to have seen the beast, and quickly determine that he was lying about the experience. He eagerly latches on to every suggestion you make and enhances it: "Yeah, it flew! It flew right over my head! And then it lay an egg! In that tree over there!" Discouraged, you wonder if anyone has actually seen the creature, or if this is all just one big hoax...
fields.title: False Trail

fields.description:
The first four days pass uneventfully. On the fifth, you wake immediately before dawn. Just as the rumors had said, the animal appears in the early dawn light. It doesn't charge like a boar or bound like a cougar; it seems to amble casually in your direction. It spots you, and a fraction of a second later it is at your throat. Desperately, you stumble backwards, and thrust outward with your knife. Just like that, it's over, and the no-longer-mythical beast lies at your feet.

You hoist the boagar over your shoulders and bring it back into town. Gasps of awe mingle with shouts of acclaim as you walk through the street. You triumphantly deposit it in the butcher's shop. "Well done!" he exclaims. "We'll have to stuff this and hang it in the tavern's great hall for all to see."

The butcher pays you the promised royals, and also gives you a sturdy vest made of cured leather. "This won't stop a spear, but it'll slow it down some. It might come in handy the next time you meet the business end of a boar!"
fields.title: Legendary Find

fields.description: Sadly, you fall asleep after the first night on watch. Tomas refuses to accompany you on such a bizarre quest, and without someone to share reconnaissance duties, this effort will probably fail. You resolve to try again later.
fields.title: Continuing to Elude

fields.description: A deception like this requires two creatures of compatible sizes and a quiet place to work. You seem cursed by misfortune, though... your boar is too large, the cougar is actually a bobcat, and several other hunters have an annoying habit of wandering into your field and asking why you're butchering out here. Best to leave it alone for now and try again later.
fields.title: Slipshod Work

fields.description:
As you assemble the cryptid, you piece together a convincing story for the butcher. You always liked the detail about the boagar only appearing at dusk and at dawn; you'll claim that it emerged from the mist, that you thought at first it was a dream, that your wild flailings with a knife caused the lacerations seen around the tusks.

The butcher buys the story, and tales of your brave exploit spread quickly throughout the town. When someone captures the actual boagar weeks later, barely anyone notices.
fields.title: A Cunning Forgery

fields.description: "I know you're new in town, and I'm glad to see you made the right choice. Now, we just need to make sure everyone else follows suit. I deserve this, you know! I was born here, grew up here, was married to three wives here. By Korol's shade, I've practically fathered a quarter of the town! Just you remind them of what they owe me, and I'll see to it that you're well rewarded."
fields.title: Put to Work

fields.description: "I'm grateful that you sought me out. Truth be told, I haven't had much fortune yet in gathering support. Sam's done a lot for the town over the years, but he's taken as much as he's given, if not more. I fear what might happen if he gains direct dominion over these peoples' lives, and not just their coin. I'll count on you to help get the word out."
fields.title: Solid as an Anvil

fields.description: "What in the name of Yarvan are you doing here? Can't you see I'm busy? These men would have cut your throat if they thought you meant to rob me! Come back later, but next time, knock first!"
fields.title: A Bad Time

fields.description: "The whole town started to go downhill when we let those peasants from the Republic in. Oh, they told pleasing tales about fleeing the chaos and needing the protective shelter of our strong Patriarch. Before they came, though, nobody would have even thought of asking the commoners about who should be elder. The Patriarch just picked someone, and that was the end of it! Febler willing, one day the Republic will be wiped off the map, and folks will forget these foolish ideas."
fields.title: Storytelling

fields.description: Peter has much to say about impure metals in iron ore, and about the deficiencies in the Republic's military strategies, but little to say of himself or his thoughts about the village. He eventually grows irritated and returns to the forge, whereupon you excuse yourself and venture back outside.
fields.title: Awkward Silences

fields.description: He never talks much about the village, but Peter grows quite animated when you ask him about his previous adventuring life. Once he starts rolling with tales about his close encounters with death, and narrow escapes from hopeless situations, you're able to slip in a question or two about his current life. He has few friends in the village, but cares deeply about its residents, and he mentions several people he has assisted in the past. You will need to find them later and ask for their support.
fields.title: Valorous Tales

fields.description: You learn that many of these people didn't even realize that the old elder is dead. You drop a few positive words in their ears about the new elder, subtly implying that his elevation is inevitable. They don't seem to care too much, which actually may help make the transition go more smoothly.
fields.title: Promises of a Better Life

fields.description: The first man you encounter openly yawns at the mention of your elder's name. The second man turns away and strides off. The third man mutters some excuse and leaves town. You are too discouraged to continue. Why don't they care more about their new elder?
fields.title: Bored

fields.description: Your quiet and calm words help persuade a merchant that choosing a new elder soon will help both herself and her village. She agrees to write her contact in the House, and even donates a few coins to the elder's cause.
fields.title: Firm Handshakes All Around

fields.description: Everyone seems to believe that you're after their money, their goods, or their contacts. A few even have the temerity to set their guards on you, and you decide to give them some time to cool off.
fields.title: Frowning Faces

fields.description: Descor seems surprised at your boldness, but reins in his horse and gives you a few moments. He nods in approval at your explanation of loyalty, and promises to give both men a fair hearing. Well, that's the best one can hope for, right? Your success is worth a few royals.
fields.title: A Quick Exchange

fields.description: Your arrival spooks the horse, and Descor trots on down the street, frowning back at you. You desperately call out your plea, but are unsure whether he hears you.
fields.title: Too Fast

fields.description: Sticking to the alleys, you unobtrusively monitor Descor's progress through the town. After visiting the blacksmith and the drygoodsman, he returns to the tavern. You slip inside, and within earshot of his table, loudly extoll the virtues of your elder. He says nothing, but seems attentive to your comments. Other supporters in the bar pay for your rounds.
fields.title: A Quiet Chat

fields.description: Sadly, your attempt at pursuit is cut short by a large man who has mistaken you for a flower thief. By the time you manage to smooth over the misunderstanding, Descor is long gone.
fields.title: Intercepted

fields.description: Andrew is a little miffed that neither candidate has visited him in person, but you're the first representative from either camp to come and listen all the way through his stories. By the time he runs out of steam, you have a good idea of what he's looking for, and you spend a few brief moments extolling your elder's virtues before he hands you a gift and shoos you out the door.
fields.title: A Good Listener

fields.description: You try to tell Andrew of your candidate's fine qualities, but he keeps interrupting you with long-winded anecdotes about the time he cornered the radish market by buying off all the ships in Risapo. You eventually declare defeat and retreat.
fields.title: No Words Edgewise

fields.description: Descor glowers at you throughout your entire interview, causing you to stammer and lose track of your arguments. He abruptly rises and bits you to return when you are ready to present your case.
fields.title: Tongue-Tied

fields.description:
You speak briefly and eloquently to Descor. "This decision isn't about Sam, or about Peter, or even about the village. It's about the Patriarch. What man will serve him best? One who is thoroughly invested in the well-being of our town and its commerce within the House? Or one with a history of wandering, whose trade depends on violence and conflict?"

The seating of the new elder takes place the very next day. The village's merchants all attend, including Peter, and vow to honor Sam's wisdom in the village. Sam, in turn, pledges his loyalty to the Patriarch, and slips you a large purse of royals. "You've gained a powerful friend today," he says. "Send word if you ever need a favor done."
fields.title: A Firm Hand

fields.description: Descor glowers at you unhappily. Too late, you realize that you have failed to pay sufficient tribute to the Patriarch. You hastily begin extolling the Patriarch's virtues, but it is too late, and Descor asks you to return tomorrow.
fields.title: An Oversight

fields.description:
You have a sense that Descor has done some adventuring in his own time, and play on this potential affinity with Peter. "Sam may have roots in the community, but Peter has roots in the whole land. He's traveled throughout the House, and knows well the sorts of trials that a village like this might encounter. And, should the worst occur and this town come under attack, you can count on Peter to inspire the locals to take up arms until the Patriarch's army arrives."

Peter is seated on the chair the very next day. A variety of people attend, from farmers to laborers to merchants. He gives a few brief words of thanks while Sam glowers behind him. When you celebrate in the tavern later that night, Peter approaches for a few words. "I don't know why you decided to spend so much time helping me, but I'm very grateful that you did. I can't truly repay you for your assistance. I will let my old friends know of your deeds, and they may help you find new opportunities."
fields.title: Installed

fields.description: Descor seems confused. "Why do you speak to me of Sam? What can you tell me of Peter?" He seems unsatisfied by your answers.
fields.title: A Rocky Course

fields.description:
Descor initially seems surprised by your about-face, but gradually warms to your idea to elevate Sam to the chair. "You have certainly spent more time in this village than me, and you have seen both men at their best and worst. Peter has struck me as a fair and honest man, but fairness and honesty do not always make for the best leader. Tell Sam that he has the victory."

Sam practically crows with delight during his seating ceremony, strutting around his house in triumph. Peter is nowhere to be seen; rumors say that he has sold his shop and returned to the road. "You backed the wrong man, but you came around in the end, and I respect that. Such efforts deserve to be rewarded well."
fields.title: A Coup

fields.description: It seems that Sam has anticipated your potential treachery. Another courier of his is already inside Descor's lodging rooms, whispering urgently. They both glare as you approach, and you decide to leave for now.
fields.title: Denied Entry

fields.description:
Descor initially balks at the thought of choosing Peter, but soon grows convinced of your good intentions. "Kaman knows that Peter doesn't have money to bribe you, so if he's convinced you that he's the better elder, then I'm inclined to believe you. I never really liked that drygoodsman, anyways. We'll hold the ceremony in the morning."

As is customary, the elder's chair is moved into Peter's dwelling, and he is invited to sit by the Patriarch's representative. Sam is nowhere to be seen; he apparently decided to travel with his caravan to miss the indignity of observing his rival's ascension. Peter does not speak long, but carefully singles you out for praise, as a fine example for the village's youth to emulate.
fields.title: A Solid Smith

fields.description: The stablemaster is sad to see the horse go, but seems pleased that you are the owner. "She forages for herself mostly, just be sure to let her graze each day, and brush her down when she needs it. You take care of her, and she'll serve you a good, long time."
fields.title: Congratulations!

fields.description: Few things are as hated in town as a horse-thief. You run away from your pursuers, but are nearly trampled below their hooves as they chase after you.
fields.title: "Stop! Thief!"

fields.description: You slip into the tavern behind your mark, then shortly walk back out again. Acting casual, you mount and swiftly ride off. You'll need to avoid this area of town for the near future; in the meantime, you make sure that as many people as possible associate you with this steed.
fields.title: Possession is Law

fields.description:
You approach Temor so quietly that he jumps up when you speak his name. "Blast, look what you've made me do! Go order me another pint of the black!"

By the time you return, he has calmed down and has a proposition for you. "I desperately need to locate some sneaky men, and you seem like the kind of sneak who could help me out. I was carrying some important messages for the Patriarch through this area last month. I learned last week that some... potential enemies of the House have learned of those messages' contents. I'll be punished no matter what, but if I can identify the man or woman who spied the messages, I may get to keep my head. Here's a list of suspects to investigate. Report back to me once you have learned their identity."
fields.title: Commissioned

fields.description: You're reasonably sure that Sam doesn't spot you throughout the whole day. He receives a steady flow of customers, all of whom seem to be local residents or nearby farmers. You report your findings to Temor, who pays you for your time.
fields.title: Upstanding Citizen

fields.description: Unfortunately, Sam makes it a point to spot anyone who looks like a potential customer, and sell them whatever overstock he has at the moment. You repeatedly deny that you need any miniature wineskins, and eventually leave.
fields.title: A Consummate Salesman

fields.description: Curses! You realize that she has known for hours that you were following, and has merely been tweaking you by going in circles. If she is guilty, she certainly won't give anything away today.
fields.title: Snapped Twigs and Lost Pride
